loans.name: Mariel

texts.en:
Running a small store is what occupies Mariel's daily schedule from 6am to 6pm. She acquires P200 a day doing these activities. She is thankful for the small business she has for she provides daily allowances for her two children. Her spouse works as a farmer. 

Mariel needs to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads and noodles to sell and that will help increase sales capacity. She is borrowing P10,000.

With continuous patience and determination, the family will achieve a better quality of life someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread and noodles to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a kind and devoted mother. She is married to a farmer and together they are raising two children. She is now 39 years old. She is in the direct sales business offering cosmetics and beauty products to her neighborhood. She had been doing this for over  five years now. She wants to increase her sales because she only generates P200 a day selling these products. Daily profits are just enough for school allowances for her children. So, she is now asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy cologne, lotions, perfumes and beauty soaps to sell. This way she would increase her income. 

With good profits from the business, she will be able to save funds for her children's education and have a secured future someday.

loans.use: to buy cologne, lotions, perfumes and beauty soaps to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn lives at Dalaoig with her spouse and three children. Aside from the farming business, her spouse also offers motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. Jocelyn would like to strengthen the transport service so she is now asking for a loan for maintenance of the business. She is now asking for P10,000 to buy new tires, crude oil and gasoline to use in the motorcycle service. 

With good profits, she hopes to provide a good education for her children. Jocelyn and her spouse will be very happy and proud if their children finish a degree and seek a good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy new tires, crude oil and gasoline to use for the motorcycle service.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta, from Dalaoig, patiently sells fruit and vegetables to the people in the village where they live. She has been doing it in order to acquire profits to supplement her spouse's income derived from their farming business. The couple has four children. Two attend school. She is hoping to increase her sales so she is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy bananas, eggplant, tomatoes and cabbages to sell. She will be very happy to meet all her customers' demand with affordable prices and friendly services she offers. Aside from increasing her sales she will also improve her relationship with her customers.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplant, tomatoes and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr Edgar tiene 30 años conviviente con su esposa más de 5 años, tienen 2 hijos dependientes que estudia en nivel primaria, con la actividad agrícola ,mantienen a su familia producen papa, haba, arveja, maíz en su terreno de 1.2 has que son herencia de sus padres, el sr. Eldgar y su familia viven en una comunidad rural de Iluri Grande a 42 km de distancia de la ciudad de Cochabamba, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos para un préstamo de dinero y les piden muchos requisitos, se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona y descubre que el sr. Edgar  necesitaba dinero para la construcción de vivienda, porque el ahorro que tenía gasto en la compra de insumos agrícolas ( abono orgánico, semilla de papa) el sr. Edgar nos comenta que ahora construirá una vivienda para sus hijos para que vivan cómodamente.
texts.en: Señor Edgar is 30 years old. He lives with his wife of more than five years. They have 2 dependent children who are in primary school. He supports his family with his agricultural work. They produce potatoes, beans, peas, and corn on their land, 1.2 hectares which are an inheritance from his parents. Sr. Edgar and his family live in the rural community of Iluri Grande, 42 km from the city of Cochabamba. Therefore it is very difficult for them to turn  to banks for a loan, and the banks have many requirements of them. He took the initiative to go to this zone, and he discovered that he needed money for the construction of a house, because the savings that he had were spent on the purchase of agricultural supplies (organic fertilizer, potato seeds). Sr. Edgar comments to us that now he will construct a house for his children so that they can live comfortably.

loans.use: to construct his house.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is 33 years old and lives in a village of the Gurjaani District. Gurjaani is known as a well developed agricultural area. Nikoloz lives with his family: his wife, Tamila, and his 7 year-old son, who goes to school. 

Nikoloz and Tamila run a family farming business, which is their only source of income. They have 1 hectare (about 10,000 square meters) of land, where they grow cucumbers, watermelons, peppers and vine-trees. Additionally, the family has a small greenhouse, where they grow cucumber and pepper saplings. They sell harvested products during the summer to local green grocery retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 600 Laris.

Nikoloz is requesting a loan to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse because the old one is torn and can’t maintain the needed temperature. A small part of the loan will be used for purchasing fuel for a tractor to till the land. 

Nikoloz and Tamila will work hard on their plot during the spring season. They hope that weather conditions will be favorable so they'll get a good harvest in summer, which will be sold for a good price. The family will earn a profit, which will be used to cover their daily expenses during the year.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for a greenhouse and fuel for a tractor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old, married to Ferdinand and has two children. Her spouse is a rice farmer. Jocelyn is also raising hogs to sell in the future. From this, she generates P3,000 for each pig she is able to dispose of. Profits earned from the business go for meals and school allowances for her children. She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for her hogs' sustainability. This will help ensure the hogs good growth. 

Someday, Jocelyn would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and make the family live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Raising hogs for future sale is the business of Mercedes. She resides at Dalaoig with her six children. She is sending one of her children to high school. The rest have settled into marriage. Mercedes is a widow. Income derived from her small business goes for meals and school expenses. She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vitamins for sustainability. 

Someday, she hopes to make her business more profitable to save funds to use when an emergency arises.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vitamins for sustainability

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 27 years old. He is single. He has spent 7 years in the business of selling roasted meat in bars. He needs a loan to buy more meats to sell as roasted meats. He plans to use the profits to buy a plot of land where he expects to reside in the future.

loans.use: To buy more roasted meats to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 44 years old, married and has four children, two of whom attend school. She is an industrious and helpful mother. The family live simply at Dalaoig. Filomena's spouse is a rice grower. To supplement her spouse's income, she raises hogs to fatten and sells them to butchers upon maturity. She would like to provide for the sustenance of her hogs but she has insufficient funds now. So, she is asking for P8,000 to buy feed and vitamins to ensure the good growth of her hogs. 

Filomena is also praying for her family's good health and a stable source of income that will lead them to a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to ensure the good growth of her hogs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a married with 5 children. She is 29 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Maricel owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns PHP 2,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 4,627 to purchase farm chemicals. Maricel has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for 5 years. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a businesswoman aged 26. She sells different merchandise such as shirts, blouses, belts and a few shoes. She has been running this business for the past 3 years. With the profits she wants to buy a house to live in. She would like to see her business grow in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
Hermie is a married woman who has three children. Hermie is 57 years old, and resides at Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Philippines. Hermie owns and operates a coconut farm for a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 9,767 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Hermie joined GDMPC. In the future, Hermie wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 27 years old. He runs a sound system business. He has been doing this business for 4 years. With the loan he wants to buy speakers and microphones to use in the business. He plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more music equipment such as speakers and microphones to use in the business.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is taking another Kiva loan of Ksh.30,000 to start another business, a retail food shop. With the loan, she wants to purchase sugar and maize flour. Since the previous loan, her monthly income has increased by 50 percent. She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing her a loan to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Miriam de 50 años de edad, dedicada a la costura, con mas de catorce años dando sus servicios a sus clientes que gracias a la experiencia y al apoyo de su señor esposo quien es sastre  y que juntos han logrado la captacion de sus clientes. Lo que se propone con este nuevo financiamiento es invertirlo en la infraestructura de un cuarto entechado del mismo e instalacion de piso. Necesitando comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de zinc, piedrin, cemento, perlin, bloques, pegamento, soldadura, golosos , arena, ladrillos entre otros. Obteniendo con esta inversion que no se le pase el agua en su habitacion ahora que estamos a las puertas de los tiempos de lluvia en nuestro pais. Expresando que esta agradecida con kiva y la micro-finaciera por el apoyo al desarrallo de su negocio en financiamientos anteriores y en esta ocasión al mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miriam is 50 years old and makes a living as a seamstress. She has provided this service to her customers for over 14 years; thanks to the experience and support of her husband, who is a tailor, together they have been able to build a strong customer base.

She will use this new loan to invest in the infrastructure of a new roof and floor for a bedroom. They will need to buy the following construction materials: sheet metal, gravel, cement, metal beams, cinder blocks, glue, welding supplies, screws, sand and bricks, amongst other things. As a result of this investment, water will not be able to come in their room, which is important because it is just beginning to be rainy season in the country.      

She expressed that she is thankful to kiva and the micro-financiers for the support to the development of their business that has been provided in previous loans, and in this case the improvement of the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to complete the construction of a room.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (aging parents). Jane lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school costs, and rent.  

Jane has a tailoring business, which she's been in for eight years. She works six days out of every week and doesn’t have any other income-generating activities. She sells her products in a shop. Jane has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of cloth and an electric sewing machine. 

Jane's main business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of cloth and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú hace 2 años, es dueña de una tienda donde vende mochilas, ella pudo aprender acerca de cómo ahorrar, la solidaridad, gracias Finca Perú pudo comprar su casa y solventar los estudios profesionales de sus hijos,ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mochilas en variados diseños y colores para su negocio.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Vida."  She is 50 years old and is the mother of 4 children.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years.  She is the owner of a store where she sells backpacks.  She was able to learn about how to save money and cooperate within her communal bank.  Thanks to Finca Peru, she was able to buy her house and pay for the college education of her children.  Now she will use this loan to buy backpacks in a variety of styles and colors for her business.

loans.use: to buy backpacks in a variety of styles and colors to sell

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es: Don Salomon es un caballero luchador y esforzado. Hoy en dia continua laborando como guarda de seguridad trabajo de mucha entrega y dedicacion ya que mediante el mismo protege la vida de otros. Agradece a Dios primeramente y luego a Afodenic que ha sido el medio para el alcanzar muchas de sus metas. Con el prestamo anterior empezo a levantar de concreto estas dos habitaciones. Hoy en dia necesita el prestamo para comprar materiales de construccion como: doce laminas de zinc, dos puertas, tubos pvc, perlin, hinodoro entre otros y de esta manera llevar a cabo el plan el cual es la conclusion de de los dos cuartos mismos que por el alto costo de los materiales de construccion no los ha podido finalizar. Alcanzando por medio de este nuevo credito mejores condiciones de vida para su familia y para su persona un logro mas.
texts.en: Salomon is a tenacious and hardworking gentleman.  Today he continues to work as a security guard.  He works with a lot of care and dedication, because through this work he protects the lives of others.  He gives thanks to God first, and then Afodenic, which has been the means through which he has been able to reach a lot of his goals.  With his previous loan he started to build these two rooms.  Today he needs a loan to buy construction materials such as: twelve sheets of corrugated metal, two doors, pvc pipes, beams, a toilet, and other materials.  In this way he can carry out his plan to finish building these two rooms, which, due to the high cost of construction materials, he has not been able to complete.  Through this loan he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family and complete another one of his personal goals.

loans.use: to finish adding rooms to his house

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Maximo de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 20 y 16 años, por los cuales trabaja muchísimo para que sean felices y que tengan una buena calidad de vida,; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad donde alberga la mayor población afroperuana de nuestro país y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores tienen un don particular, cocinan de manera deliciosa y sobre todo son personas muy carismáticas y amables. Cuando Maximo dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar las noticias para poder estar enterado de lo pasa en la actualidad; asimismo le encanta disfrutar uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pato”.

Con mucho carisma Maximo abre su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde tempranas horas de la mañana, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 35 clientes en el dia, el cree que le va bien en el negocio porque brinda una buena atención al público.

Maximo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio en especial arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, entre otros; lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y así seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una gran tienda y ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Maximo, 46, lives with his wife and 2 children who are 20 and 16. He works hard so that they will be happy and have a good quality of life. His house is in the city of Chincha, home of the largest Afro-Peruvian population in the country, and cradle of Peruvian athletics. The people are known in particular for their delicious cooking, and for being very friendly and charismatic. When Maximo has free time he likes to listen to the news so he can stay current. He also likes to enjoy one of his favorite dishes, arroz con pato [rice with duck]. 

With great care, Maximo opens his grocery story early in the morning. He works around 10 hours a day and attends to as many as 35 customers. He thinks that his business is going well because he provides good customer service.

Maximo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy more merchandise for his store, in particular rice, sugar, oil, milk and other things. This will give him a greater variety of prodcuts to offer and he will be able to continue fighting each day to achieve his dream: "having a big store and being a successful small businessman."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc).

loans.name: Moustapha Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Moustapha est un jeune sénégalais de 25 ans qui pratique depuis plus de 2 ans l’aviculture. Parallèlement  il fait des reportages dans les cérémonies familiales (films, photos, etc.). Il a choisi l’aviculture par passion mais aussi a cause du rendement  intéressant  qu’il procure comparé aux services de reportage qu’il offre a la population de sa communauté ou il vit. Et ce sont les profits qu’il tire de ce business qui l’intéresse  le plus dans cette activité. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2010. Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur et sollicite un prêt  de 450 000 prévus pour s’approvisionner en poussins et aliments pour une nouvelle opération. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices permet au célibataire de participer dans la gestion  et l’amélioration des conditions sociales de la famille qui est composée de ses parents, ainsi que de ses  frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
Moustapha Aliou, age 25, is a young Senegalese man who has been involved in poultry farming for over two years.  Additionally, he also takes photographs and makes videos during family celebrations.  He chose to raise poultry by passion but also because this activity brings better returns than the photo and video-recording services he provides in his local community.  He is mostly interested in the profits generated by the poultry business.  

Moustapha has been a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC since October 2010.  He has already repaid a previous loan and is requesting a loan of 450,000 francs to make another purchase of chicks and feed.  Increased profits allow this single man to financially help his family and to improve the social condition of his parents, brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Ndeye Walimata

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  Walimata est une femme mariée de 39 ans qui vit  au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 5  enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 15 ans. Elle est âgée  de 39 ans et s’active dans le secteur du commerce. Elle vend des jus de fruits et de la glace depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but de gagner des bénéfices et subvenir aux  besoins familiaux. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus demeure l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa localité d’habitation depuis janvier 2012. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un nouveau réfrigérateur pour mieux relancer la vente de jus. Son objectif est d’améliorer la rentabilité de son activité pour rendre meilleur la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndeye Walimata is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal.  She is the mother of five children, whose ages range between 4 and 15 years.  She is actively involved in retail business and has been selling fruit juices and ice for more than 10 years.  She chose this activity in order to make some profits and to take care of her family's needs.  She is mostly interested in the lucrative aspect of her business.  

Ndeye Walimata has been a member of the local UIMCEC branch since January 2012.  She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for the purchase of a new refrigerator which will help her to boost her sales of fruit juices.  

Her goal is to increase the profitability of her business in order to improve her family's social condition.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba est femme de 48ans. Elle est mariée à un menuisier et a 02 enfants. Le premier a 36ans et le dernier 32ans. Elle est revendeuse de céréales (maïs, sorgho, haricot) et divers  dans sa maison. Activité qu’elle a démarrée en 1998 et qui l’aide à prendre soin de la famille. Elle est à son second crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour l’achat de céréales et produits divers. Elle s’approvisionne souvent à Lomé. Elle veut aider son mari dans les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a 48-year-old woman. She is married to a carpenter and has 2 children. The eldest is 36 years old and the youngest 32. Ayaba resells cereals (corn, sorghum, beans) and various other products from her home. She started this business, which enables her to take care of her family, in 1998.

This is Ayaba's second loan, which she has requested in order to buy cereals and various other products. She often gets her supplies in Lomé. She wishes to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cereals, flour, etc.

loans.name: Afsétou

texts.fr: Afsétou est une femme âgée de 29ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur de pièces détachées et a 03 enfants. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbon de bois et du riz. (Activité qu’elle mène depuis 2001 et qui l’aide à supporter les charges du ménage). Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de l’intérieur. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afsétou is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to a spare parts reseller and has 3 children.

This will be Afsétou 's 2nd loan from WAGES and she has requested it so that she can buy some bags of charcoal and some rice. She has been reselling these products since 2001, and her business enables her to manage the household expenses. She gets her supplies from domestic markets. Afsétou wants to reinvest in her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and rice.

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Kossivi est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Il a 01 enfant âgé de 02ans.
Kossivi travaille comme mécanicien auto  et  revendeur de pièces détachées auto depuis 2001. Il exerce son activité dans un garage et sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter des pièces pour la vente et la réparation des voitures.
Kossivi veut réinvestir dans l’activité, réaliser des bénéfices et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Kossivi is a 31-year-old man. He is married to a seamstress and has a 2-year-old child.

Kossivi has been working as a car mechanic and spare parts reseller since 2001. He works in a garage and is requesting this 2nd loan in order to buy spare parts for the repair and resale of cars.

Kossivi wishes to reinvest in his business, make a profit and provide for his family's basic needs

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the repair and resale of cars.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 25 years old. She earns her living by providing mobile money transfers at the biggest hospital in Zambia, the University Teaching Hospital (UTH).

When Florence finished secondary school, she opened her own hair salon as she was pursuing an accounting course in a town called Ndola which is near her home village. For the first year of college she remained in her village during the week to operate her hair salon and went to Ndola only on the weekends to attend classes. After one year of commuting, she closed the hair salon and used the profits from her salon to relocate to Ndola to study full time and she finally got her Technician Certificate in Accounting.

She then relocated to Lusaka, the capital of Zambia, where she started running her mobile money transfer business a month ago.

Florence says her business is very important. Growing up, she saw many people in her village try to send and receive money at the post office where her father worked. Many times people would be frustrated when the post office was unable to pay them their money.

Florence is requesting a loan in order to increase her working capital and increase the number of customers at her shop. With her shop near the hospital, many of Florence’s customers urgently need to receive money, and her shop will help them do just that.

loans.use: To add on to her small working capital so that she can be able to serve all the customers that come to her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, salt, and butter.

loans.name: Maria Maira De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, quiere continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mariscos frescos como pescado, camarones, mejorando la variedad y el inventario para disponer y ofrecer a la clientela.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mantener el negocio, realizo una buena inversión y esto le permite estar mejorando y superándose junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María would like to continue investing in her business, and she is seeking a new loan to buy fresh seafood, such as fish and shrimp, thereby improving the variety of her stock and the inventory she can offer her clients.

Her previous loan helped her maintain her business; she made a good investment with it, and this allowed her to improve and overcome her situation together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Adjowoa

texts.fr:
Adjowoa est une femme âgé(e) de 36ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et a 02 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 10ans et le dernier 05ans.
Adjowoa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1996. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et vend seule à ses clients à la maison.
Adjowoa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale(riz, sucre, huile végétale…) 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjowoa voudrait augmenter son stock, aider son mari dans les charges du ménage et assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjowoa is a 36 year-old woman. She is married to a reseller and has 2 children, both of whom attend school. The eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 5.

Adjowoa has been working as a grocery retailer since 1996. She gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market and sells to her customers from her home, working alone.

Adjowoa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc.) In the years ahead, she would like to increase her inventory, support her husband with the household expenses and provide her children with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Adzaguenou

texts.fr:
Adzaguenou est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Adzaguenou travaille comme revendeur d’huile à moteur  depuis 2006. Il vend seul à coté d’un marché de la place et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Adzaguenou a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’huile à moteur.
Dans les prochaines années, il veut augmenter son stock et améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Adzaguenou is a 31-year-old man. He is single and has no children.

Adzaguenou has been reselling engine oil since 2006. He works alone, selling his merchandise near a local market. He gets his supplies in Lomé. His principal difficulty is poor sales.

Adzaguenou has requested his 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy engine oil. In the coming years, he would like to increase his inventory and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy engine oil.

loans.name: Horison Manuel

texts.es: Horison de 47 años  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 22 años. Él se dedica a la venta de pescados y mariscos en general, negocio que inició desde hace 18 años,  ante la necesidad de mejorara los ingresos familiares y bridarle un mayor bienestar a sus hijos. Inicio con venta ambulante de filete de robalo, salmón y corvina, por las calles de Cartagena, la ciudad heroica de Colombia, llegando así a cubrir las necesidades de consumos de muchas familias de esa ciudad. Hoy su número de barrios ha incrementado y ha incluido en su oferta otros productos del mar como camarón, cazuela de mariscos, chipichipi, ostras etc. Con su negocio le ha ido muy bien porque es reconocida la calidad y frescura de sus productos, además de su actitud alegre para vender.  Su meta es comprar en mayores cantidades, pero su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a sus planes apoyados en su demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pescados y mariscos en mayor volumen; su inversión será exitosa porque la fundamenta en muchos pedidos solicitados por sus clientes, a propósito de la semana mayor, donde baja el consumo de carnes, para dar paso al consumo de productos del mar y para cumplir con una parte de la tradición de abstinencia, como lo hacen  gran parte de los clientes, a los que Horison les vende..
texts.en:
Horison, aged 47, lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and two children, aged 20 and 22.  

He works selling fish and seafood in general, a business which he began 18 years ago out of the need to improve his family's income and provide a better standard of living to his children.  He began as a street vendor, selling fillets of bass, salmon and sea bass on the streets of Cartagena, the "heroic" city of Colombia.  He covered the consumption needs of many families in the city in this way.

Today the number of neighborhoods that he serves has increased, and he has added to his offerings other seafood products such as shrimp, seafood casserole, clams, oysters, etc.  Things have been going very well for him with this business, because he is recognized for the quality and freshness of his products as well as his happy attitude selling them.

His goal is to purchase in larger quantities, but his biggest challenge is that his working capital is insufficient to meet his plans to support demand.  This is the reasons that he has come for a Kiva loan, which is his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  By means of this loan, he will purchase fish and shellfish in greater volume.  His investment will be successful, because it is grounded in the many orders placed by his customers for Easter Week, when people don't eat meat but shift to seafood to comply with part of the Lent tradition.  These customers make up a large share of the customers to whom Horison sells.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shellfish in greater volume.

loans.name: Nyuilenam

texts.fr:
Nyuielenam est une femme âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un vendeur et a 01 enfant de 04ans.  
Nyuielenam travaille comme revendeuse de prêt à porter et de produits de beauté depuis 2009.Elle exerce son activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. La mévente est la difficulté principale qu’elle rencontre.
Nyuielenam a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des habits, des produits de beauté et des liqueurs.
Dans les prochaines années, Nyuielenam veut renforcer son activité et assurer la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Nyuielenam is a 34-year-old woman. She is married to a salesman and has a 4-year-old child.

Nyuielenam has been working as a retailer of ready-to-wear clothing and beauty products since 2009. She carries out her business in a shop and gets her supplies in Lomé. The main challenge that she faces is poor sales.

Nyuielenam has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy clothing, beauty products and liqueurs. In the years ahead, she would like to strengthen her business and ensure that her family is healthy.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme  âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est mariée à un coiffeur .
Akossiwa travaille comme coiffeuse mais ajoute à cette activité la vente de produits de beauté depuis 2006. Elle vend ses produits à ses clients et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Deux personnes l’aident dans son activité et sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Akossiwa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  des produits de beauté, des mèches et divers.. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir  afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a hairdresser.

Akossiwa is a hairdresser and has also been selling beauty products since 2006. She sells the products to her customers and gets her supplies in Lomé. Two people help her with her business, and her main challenge is poor sales.

Akossiwa has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy beauty products, hair extensions and various other products. She would like to reinvest in her business and grow it, so that she is better able to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair entensions.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 29 years old. He lives in the Gurjaani District with his family: mother, elder brother, sister in law and elder sister. Zurab and his brother are tractor operators. They have tractors and provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers for a certain fee. 

Along with the above mentioned, the family is busy with agriculture. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. 

Also, Zurab’s mother and sister work hard on a family owned plot of land, where maize and grapevines are grown. They sell harvested products locally, to greengrocery products retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris.

Zurab requested credit for purchasing young grapevines to plant and expand the vineyard. Also, part of the credit will be used for purchasing maize for sowing and fuel for the tractor to till the land. The expansion of the vineyard will give additional income to the family over the long-term, as they will harvest and sell more grapes. The family will use the increased income for further development of the family farm, to make it more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase maize for sowing and young grapevines.

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr:
Délali est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un  électronicien.
Délali travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale et des cartes de recharges  depuis 2008. Elle vend seule à ses clients et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui, permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre à la demande de la population. Elle veut augmenter son activité et mieux assurer les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Délali is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to an electronics engineer.

Délali has been working as a retailer of grocery products and phone charge cards since 2008. She works alone and gets her supplies in Lomé. 

Délali is requesting her first loan which will allow her to buy more products so that she can better respond to people's demands. She wishes to increase her business and better provide for the household.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Señora Elena tiene 37 años de edad es madre de tres hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, viven en la zona de Maica Sud - Kenamari  ella se dedica a la producción de leche como su primera actividad y su segunda actividad la elaboración de quesillos, con una experiencia de diez años en dichas actividades. 
Ella es madre de tres hijos  dos mujeres y un varón todos son pequeños, el padre los abandono hace seis años atrás no saben nada de el. Elena se tuvo que dedicar de por completo a la educación de sus hijos y salir adelante ella entrega leche a la Pil cada día trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana todos los días y luego los prepara a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela. 

Ella solicita el crédito para compra de soya, ya que con la temporada de lluvia se perdió todos los sembradíos de alf alfa que tenían, entonces le toca comprar soya para poder alimentar a su ganado y de esa manera tener más producción.  Elena es una persona responsable y dedicada al trabajo, ella sueña con que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y lo posterior estudiar alguna carrera ya que ella solo estudio la primaria y no tuvo una buena educación.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old. She is a mother of three children who depend on her financially. They live in the area of Maica Sud - Kenamari. She works in milk production as a first activity and her second activity is making fresh cheese. She has been doing both activities for ten years. 
 
She is the mother of three children, two girls and a boy, all of them young. Their father abandoned them six years ago and they haven't heard anything from him. Elena had to dedicate herself completely to raising her children and get ahead. She delivers milk to La Pil every day, working from 5 in the morning every day. Later she gets her children ready to go to school. 

She is asking for the loan to buy soy, since she lost all of her alfalfa during the rainy season. She has to buy soy to feed her cattle so they will have a higher production. Elena is a a responsible person who is dedicated to her work. Her dream is for her children to finish high school and latter go on to college. She was only able to go to primary school and didn't have a good education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is a widow with three children, none of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand and hire more employees in the business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale in order to start a firewood selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to start a firewood selling business by purchasing bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 48 years old and married with four children between the ages of 20 and 25. All her children go to school. She is a dealer in cow and goat hides. She has been in the business for 19 years. With the loan, she will buy hides in large quantities to resell. She wants to use the profits from the business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy hides in large quantities to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives humbly in Bayo with her spouse and children. She had seven children, four of whom have settled into marriage and live separately. The rest are still attending school. To make a living, Elizabeth patiently sells grocery items to the people in her village. She had been doing it for over six years. 

She still aims for business improvement, so she is now asking for additional capital to buy more products to offer. This way, she will upgrade her daily income derived from the business. She is asking for P30,000 to buy eggs, sardines, coffee, biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her store. With part of the loan she will invest in buying hogs to raise and sell in the future for additional income. 

Someday, Elizabeth would like to have a stable source of income and achieve her ultimate dream of economic stability.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sardines, coffee, biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Perla

texts.en:
This is Perla, 37, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Roberto, a driver. She, along with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Perla maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought for cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php21,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Perla fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is raising hogs to fatten and breed. She usually sells the raised hogs to the butchers who come into their village. As of now, all her hogs have been sold and she earned about P7,000. This goes for meals, bills at home and the allowance of her one child. She had five children in all, but the rest have already finished their education. 

She would like to ask for additional capital of P12,000 to buy piglets to raise, along with their feed and vaccines for sustainability. Someday, she hopes to continue growing as a successful hog raiser and have a stable source of income which will lead her toward economic stability.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, along with their feed and vaccines for sustainability.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 10 children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Josephine has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of both wholesale and retail.     

She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of school uniform material and thread. She also generates additional income through mobile phone charging, mobile money and rental rooms. The main business challenges for Josephine include seasonality and defaulters. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a vocational training school and to educate her children up to university level. She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of school uniform material and thread.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Mariam dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 31 years old. She runs a beauty salon for ladies. She wants the loan to buy more salon equipment for her business. In the future, she wants to equip and to own a very big salon from the profits that will be obtained from the business on a daily basis.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment to use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyangu, membre d’une corporation d’affaire, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 36 ans. Elle est  vendeuse au marché centrale Virunga. Son mari est un agent de sécurité et maintien de l’ordre public. Elle a commencé son business dans sa jeune quand elle  rata sa scolarité vers les années 1992, alors avant qu’elle fut mariée. Ainsi, elle reçoit régulièrement  le crédit de Hekima pour renforcer  ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  11eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent significativement. Ainsi, elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  40 pièces de pagnes. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et  construire une clôture. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The customer, Kyangu, is a member of a business corporation. She is 36 years old, a dynamic woman and an experienced entrepreneur. She is a vendor at the central market of Virunga. Her husband is a security officer and maintains public order. She started her business at a young age, around 1992, after dropping out of school and before she was married.

Kyangu has been regularly receiving loans from Hekima in order to strengthen her business. The profits from her business are used to feed the family, support her children's education and build up her savings. She has just received her 11th loan. 

Since receiving her first loan, this customer has seen her business prosper significantly. She has therefore decided to increase the amount of her loan for this new cycle. This new loan will serve to pay for 40 pieces of pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African material).

Kyangu would also like to see her children grow up, and build a fence. 

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to empower women with lower incomes.

loans.use: to buy 40 pieces of pagnes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es conviviente y vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el centro poblado Los Positos, en el distrito de Túcume. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercialización de  animales.

La actividad comercial es la venta de animales. Además brinda servicio de costura.Cuenta con experiencia de  02  años.Negocio de venta de animales y otros. Adicionalmente  labora como jornal, ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela fija (comerciantes de mercados).

El préstamo se destinara para inversión en compra de  animales, alimento y arreglo de corral.Actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la venta de  animales, alimento y arreglo de corral que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona. Su esposo labora como chofer.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a 25 year old woman. She lives with her partner in her own house, which is located in the populated center Los Positos, in the district of Tucume.  The quality of life in the community is of subsistence.  The majority are independent workers in commercial animal businesses.

The commercial business is the sale of animals.  Furthermore, she offers a sewing service. She has two years of experience in the business of animal sales and others.  Additionally she works for day's wages, located in her own home with fixed clients (market storekeepers).

The loan will be set aside for investment in buying animals, food and farmyard repairs.  Currently she has proposed to expand her inventory regarding the sale of animals, food and farmyard repairs, which is a very profitable business in the area.  Her partner works as a chauffeur.

loans.use: to buy cattle, food and farmyard repairs.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabet

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 53 años de edad, con dos hijos a cargo. Cuenta con domicilio en el sector denominado Godofredo García Vásquez, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, domicilio que sólo cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
La actividad que realiza la titular es la venta de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas en su domicilio, en el que atiende todos los días de la semana y como actividad complementaria realiza labores de costura y confección a clientes ya conocidos. Esta última actividad viene siendo ejercida desde hace 4 años y es un apoyo para la primera actividad mencionada supra.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de S/. 2500 (Dos mil quinientos nuevos soles), cuya finalidad será adquirir artículos de primera necesidad tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, bebidas, etc. para el abastecimiento de su bodega.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 53-year-old woman with two children in her care. Her home is located in the area known as Godofredo García Vásquez, which is in a rural area of the district of Tambogrande; the address only has electricity. 

Maritza sells groceries, drinks, and candy from her home, which she does every day. As a supplementary activity she also works as a seamstress and dressmaker for current customers. This second activity she has been doing for four years, and supports the first business mentioned above. 

The total of the requested loan is 2500 Peruvian soles, which will be used to buy basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, drinks, etc. to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín es un hombre de 51 años de edad, convive con su esposa y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Su domicilio propio se ubica en el Caserío Pachas, en el distrito de Chulucanas. Vive en la parte rural del referido distrito, pero cuenta con servicio eléctrico.
La actividad a la que se dedica Martín es a la crianza de animales menores o ganado pequeño (caprinos y porcinos) los cuales al alcanzar su tamaño y peso ideal, se venden en el mercado local, Adicionalmente, trabaja en una empresa en donde recibe un salario cada 15 días.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, especialmente en el techo de la misma, ya que ha sufrido daños y quiere arreglarlos y remodelar dicha parte de la casa.
texts.en:
Martín is a 51 year old man living with his wife and son who is in his care.  His house is located in Pachas hamlet in Chulucanas District.  He lives in the rural part of said district but does have electricity.

Martín’s activity is raising small farm animals or small livestock (goats and pigs) which when they reach ideal size and weight are sold in the local market.  He’s also employed by a firm and earns a salary paid to him every 15 days.

The 1500 new sol loan will be used for home improvements, especially for the roof which has been damaged and he wants to repair and remodel it.

loans.use: to improve the roof of his home, which was damaged by rain

loans.name: Ada Crizalida

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer de 53 años de edad, es conviviente, con 1 hijo. Tiene buenas relaciones con sus vecinos. Vive en Oyotún, con buenas referencias personales.
La actividad que desarrolla Ada es la venta de productos de primer necesidad, tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, en una bodega, la cual esta en una parte de la sala de su domicilio. Además  cuenta con buen nivel de inventarios para su negocio. 
El monto solicitado por Ada es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados en la compra de mercadería para surtir bodega, productos como leche, huevos, útiles de aseo, etc. para así seguir creciendo en su negocio y llevar una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ada, 53, lives with her partner and one son. They get along well with their neighbors in Oyotún and have good personal references.

Ada sells basic groceries like rice, sugar, milk and beans in a store located in the living room of her home. She has a good amount of inventory for her store.

Ada requested 1000 nuevos soles which will be used to buy merchandise to stock her store - products like milk, eggs, cleaning products, etc - to keep growing her business and have a better quality of life for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy basic goods - milk, eggs, etc - to stock her store.

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda es una mujer de 50 años de  edad, es viuda y mantiene a 1 solo hijo pues los demás ya son independientes. Su casa es propia y es de material semirústico.Se ubica en su parcela agrícola en la cual tiene mango y limón el cual cosecha semanalmente generándole ingresos. Su domicilio se ubica en Caserío Hualtaco II que está a 8 Km de Tambogrande, cuenta con servicio de luz pero no con agua ni desagüe.
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es el negocio de crianza de animales como pavos, gallinas y también vende limón que cosecha de su parcela semanalmente generándole ingresos con los cuales va a afrontar presente crédito.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, y lo solicita para la compra de alimento para sus aves y mejoras en su corral y seguir creciendo en su actividad. De esta manera, genera más dividendos y crece en su negocio, haciéndose conocido en la zona y captando más clientes.
texts.en:
Teolinda is a 50-year-old woman. She is a widow and supports only 1 child, since the others are already independent. Her house is her own, and it is made of semi-rustic material. It is located on her plot of farmland, which has mango and lime trees. She harvests these every week, generating income. Her home is located in the Hualtaco II settlement, which is 8 kilometers from Tambogrande. She has electricity service but no water or sewer connections. 

The work that the borrower does is running a business raising animals such as turkeys and chickens. She also sells limes which she harvests from her plot of land each week, generating income with which she will be able to pay off the present loan. 

The amount of the loan she is requesting is 1500 Peruvian new soles, and she is requesting it to buy feed for her birds and make improvements to their enclosure, in order to keep expanding her business. In this way, she will generate more dividends and grow her business, making herself better known in the area and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy feed for her poultry and improve their enclosure.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 33 años madre de tres hijos, vive en la parroquia de "Abrahan Calazacón" en "Santo Domingo" que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

A pesar de únicamente contar con la educación primaria, ha sabido mantener a sus hijos y darles tolo lo necesario para que lleven una vida modesta, y a pesar de las carencias que pudieran tener, no les ha faltado el amor y dedicación de su madre. Ella trabaja desde hace algunos años vendiendo comida asada, la cual prepara en una parrilla mediana en un puesto de comida a la intemperie; su jornada laboral es de cuatro horas al día. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus familiares.

Su parrilla ya necesita renovación, tiene varios agujeros a los lados. También quiere comprar una carpa y una hielera, y al no tener los recursos económicos disponibles ha optado por solicitar un crédito el cual le permita realizar esta inversión para que así pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y atraer nuevos.

Ella quiere incrementar sus ingresos, quisiera algún día tener un negocio más formal y a largo plazo construir su casa propia de tal manera que pueda asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a 33 year old mother of three. She lives in the parish of "Abrahan Calazacón" in Santo Domingo, a canton in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. It is one of the most densely populated cantons in Ecuador. It is very popular because it has monuments throughout the city, including the Monument of the Indio Colorado, an area known as the “Colorado For in the Road”.  Santo Domingo is a privileged canton with marvelous, hardworking and enterprising people who welcome tourists with open arms to show them what is wonderful about their culture and environment. 

Despite only having a primary school education, she has been able to support her children and give them everything they need to live a modest life. Despite the lack of things they could have, they haven't lacked for love and dedication from their mother. She has worked for some years selling grilled meat. She cooks it on a medium sized grill outside. Her daily shift is four hours long. She learned this trade from some relatives. 

Her grill needs to be fixed; it has holes on the sides. She also wants to buy a tent and a cooler. Since she doesn't have the necessary financial resources available, she has decided to ask for a loan, which wil allow her to make this investment so she can better attend to her customers and attract new ones. 

She wants to increase her income and would one day like to have a more formal business and in the long term build her own home so she can ensure her children's future.

loans.use: to buy a new grill, a tent and a cooler.

loans.name: Fatouma

texts.en: Fatouma is age 50. She sells charcoal and has been doing this business for the past 11 years. She is married with 8 children and all go to school. She has requested the loan to buy more charcoal for resale. With the profits, she would love to see her business prospering by adding more merchandise, as well as paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 52, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Nerio, a security guard, and is mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Emma is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sells them per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emma dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of mineral water products needed in her business

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is aged 31. She is married to a businessman. They have one child who is five years old.

She has spent four years in the business of selling meat. She has requested the loan to add more meat to the butchery to sell. With the profits from the business she plans to make more savings until she reaches the time of getting enough money to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 50 years old. She has five children aged between 9 and 28. All of them are enrolled in school. She wants the loan to buy more fruits to sell such as mangoes and oranges. She wants to use the profits for renovating the house. She would like to have a prospering business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 45, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Amos, a dentist. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mary Grace operates a dental clinic. She manages their dental clinic's operation while her husband attends to the patients. They offer dental check ups, tooth extraction and other dental procedures. She also earns by selling direct selling products for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her dental clinic and to buy supplies and materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Grace dreams of expanding her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and materials needed in her business

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en:
Constantine is 31 years old. She is married with two children and both go to school. Her husband works as a policeman.

She has been a tailor for the past 11 years. With the loan she wants to upgrade her sewing business through buying an embroidery sewing machine. She wants to make more savings from the profits until she can establish a sewing industry, because she has a dream for that in the future.

loans.use: to buy a embroidery sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre d’une communauté d’affaire, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 36 ans, mère de 11 enfants parmi les quels deux naissances de jumeaux. Elle est  vendeuse au marché centrale Virunga. Son mari est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat aux titres fonciers et cadastres. Elle a commencé son business par un fonds propre reçu de son mari, alors après qu’elle fut mariée. Ainsi, elle reçoit régulièrement  le crédit de Hekima pour renforcer  ses affaires. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires baissent sensiblement suite à une crise financière qui se profilait à l’horizon après les élections au pays. Ainsi, elle a  décidé de diminuer son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  1 ballon de friperie et le reste d’argent sera affecté à la scolarité des enfants. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et  acheter une parcelle. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The client is part of a business community. She's an energetic woman and an experienced entrepreneur. She's 36 years old and the mother of eleven children. On two occasions, she gave birth to twins.

She's a seller at the central market Virunga. Her husband is a civil servant with the state's land registry office. She started her business on her own funds, that she got from her husband after their wedding.

On a regular basis, she receives a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, to strengthen her business. She just received her eighth loan. During the previous loan cycle, her sales declined measurably, following a financial crisis looming on the horizon after the country's elections. 

Consequently, she decided to seek a smaller amount for this new cycle. She will use this new loan to purchase one bale of secondhand clothing, and use the remainder to pay her children's school expenses. In addition, she would like to see her children grow and buy a land lot.

She thanks Hekima for its action aimed at making low-income women self-sustaining.

loans.use: to buy one bale one secondhand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit  Justice, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur expérimentée, hautement ambitieuse, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 7 enfants parmi les quels il y a la naissance de jumeaux. Elle est  sociétaire d’un magasin au centre ville de Goma . Son mari est un banquier  dans société bancaire et d’immobiliers. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle fut mariée par la vente de petits articles à ses pairs. Il ya 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité d’affaire. Ainsi, elle reçoit régulièrement  le crédit de Hekima pour renforcer  ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  6eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent significativement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  50 douzaines de layettes au niveau de Kampala.. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et offrir à son mari une surprise cadeau précieux d’une Voiture de lux pour son déplacement. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The client is a member of Justice Group. She's an energetic woman, an experienced entrepreneur, and very ambitious. She's 40 years old and the mother of seven children, out of whom two are twins.

She runs a shop in downtown Goma. Her husband is a banker with a banking and real-estate company. She started her business after getting married, by selling small items to her peers.

She's been running her business for 13 years. On a regular basis, she gets a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, in order to bolster her business. Her profits are used for savings, for food, and to help cover her children's school expenses.

She just received her sixth loan. During the last loan cycle, her business thrived significantly. Consequently, she decided to seek a bigger loan for this new cycle. She will use her new loan to buy 50 dozen layettes in Kampala.   

In addition, she would like to see her children grow and surprise her husband by offering him a car. She thanks Hekima for its actions aimed at making low-income women self-sustaining.

loans.use: to buy 50 dozen layettes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Erminia

texts.en:
This is Erminia, a 36-year-old resident of Quezon city, Philippines, is married to Nestor, a vendor. Together, they manages their household while operating their businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Erminia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Erminia is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Erminia dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia, 62, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Leovigildo. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ofelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ofelia dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie lives in Uganda. She is married and has ten children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Sophie lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.   

Sophie has a business of selling of beer. She has been in this business for six years, and she works six days out of every week. Sophie sells her products in a shop by means of retail. 

Sophie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda. 

The main business challenges for Sophie include rainy season and thieves. Her goals for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un gendarme. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 17 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1998. Elle vend des céréales et des tubercules d’ignames pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Afi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des tubercules d’ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait constituer une réserve de céréales qu’elle pourra revendre pendant les périodes de soudure. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir à tous les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to a police officer. She has 3 children who all go to school. The eldest is 17 and the youngest 8.

Afi has been a retailer since 1998. She sells cereals and yams to all types of customers at the market. She gets her produce in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her main problem is a lack of inventory.

Afi has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals and yams. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the years ahead, Afi would like to create a store of cereals which she could then resell during lean periods. She plans to use her profits to meet all of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals and yams.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo tiene 48 años, vive en Tarija en la zona de la Comunidad de San Andres se encuentra casado tiene 3 hijos que dependen de sus ingresos. 
El señor Arturo se dedica a la actividad agricola, cultivan y cosechan hortalizas para comercializarlas en el mercado local, cuenta tambien con ganado vacuno, que le ayudan en la siembra de sus cultivos.
Arturo desea aumentar sus ingresos para ello esta invirtiendo en la compra de semilla y abono para la siembra de hortalizas en su terreno de este modo podra generar mas ingresos y en la siguiente oportunidad tener mayor capital y poder invertir en mas semillas.
texts.en:
Arturo is 48 years old and he lives in Tarija, which is in the area of the San Andres Community. He is married and has three children who depend on his income. Arturo is a farmer and he plants and harvests vegetables in order to sell them at the local market. He also has cattle, which help him in planting his crops. 

Arturo would like to increase his income and that is why he is investing in purchasing seeds and fertilizer for planting vegetables on his land. He hopes to increase his income and have more capital that he will continue to invest in buying more seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Nelly Carmita

texts.es: Nelly  de 41   años vive ( duran Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es la venta de comidas  le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días sola es madre soltera  la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia  . a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande tener su vivienda en buen estado  y darle lo mejor a sus hijos  . con el préstamo comprara (víveres, como carnes, frutas, vegetales)
texts.en: Nelly is 41 years old and lives in Guayaquil. She decided to start this business because it's a good way to make the money she needs to take care of her children. Nelly likes her work selling food and it has been going well, thank God. She works everyday by herself. She is a single mother. Her biggest problem is crime. In the future she would like to have a bigger business, improve the condition of her home and provide nothing but the best for her children. With her loan she will buy food like meat, fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy meat, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus from Thika is a 43-year-old man. He is widowed and he lives with his three children (two sons and one daughter) between the age of 5 and 22. He works very hard to feed his family and pay for his children's school fees. To do this, he involved himself in a quarrying business, where he has been selling building stones to contractors for the last ten years. In addition, he also earns income by farming. 

Erastus faces a challenge of poor roads, making it difficult to deliver building stones to customers. 

With the objective of expanding his business, Erastus looks for a loan of KES 10,000 that will enable him to pay for the labor of new employees to increase the sale of building stones.

Previously, he had taken a loan of KES 50,000 and he managed to pay it fully. Erastus hopes to use the anticipated profits to educate his children to university level. Also, he see himself owning a lorry that will assist him in transportation of the building stones.

loans.use: to pay for the labor of employees.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 54, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Allan, who is self-employed, and she is a mother to her children. While attending to her family needs, she also attends to her business as her way of helping her husband in meeting daily expenses.

Teresita owns a junk shop.
