Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and while waiting for local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like copper, plastic, paper, etc. They sell these to junk shops like Melanie’s for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to factories or to a bigger junk shops. Teresita earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in her daily sales.

Teresita is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 that will help to continue her business well. She will be using the loan to buy more recyclable materials from scavengers. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children.

Teresita dreams that her junk shop will last and continue to grow. She wants her children to finish studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She dreams of having her own car to drive someday. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 33 years old and married to a technician, a field that she herself spent five years in. Now operating a food market, Odette is requesting a loan  to purchase more items to sell such as tomatoes, rice, and sugar. With the profits from the business she wants to buy cows for providing milk to the family. Odette wants to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items such as tomatoes, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un professeur. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 11 ans et le dernier a 11 mois.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Akossiwa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akossiwa voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité et devenir grossiste. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille et impliquer des membres de sa famille dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a teacher. She has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. The eldest is 11 years old and the youngest 11 months.

Akossiwa has been working as a retailer since 2005. She sells grocery products to all sorts of customers in her store. She gets her products in Lomé and works alone. Right now, her main problem is her inability to meet all of her customers' demands.

Akossiwa has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the years ahead, Akossiwa would like to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family and involve some family members in the business.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Abla travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Abla a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Abla voudrait acheter plus de sacs de charbon lors des prochaines commandes. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Abla is a 45-year old woman. She is single. Since 1995, Abla has been working as a re-seller. She sells charcoal to many different customers at the market. Abla buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her biggest challenge is slow sales. Abla has obtained her second loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal. She wants to re-invest in her business. Over the next few years, Abla would like to buy more sacks of charcoal for her future orders. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Darwin Javier

texts.es:
DARWIN JAVIER tiene 38 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años de edad en San Miguel de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC EL CONSUELO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Consuelo y se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

DARWIN JAVIER se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, maíz, además tiene ganado y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, balanceado. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar la producción. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel cada ocho días. El sueño es poder  incrementar el ahorro a la familia, tener un producto de calidad, tener un alto valor económico.

En el tiempo libre le gusta bailar en la época del carnaval.
texts.en:
Darwin Javier is 38 years old and is married with three children. He lives with his wife and his kids aged 9,11 and 13 in San Miguel de Bolivar.
He is a member of the VRC El Consuelo, which is located in Recinto el Consuelo and is dedicated to agriculture and livestock. 

Darwin Javier is a farmer and he grows corn and blackberries and also has cattle and chickens. He is requesting the loan in order to buy fertilizers and insecticides.  With the loan, he will be able to increase his production. He makes purchases and sells his goods in San Miguel every 8 days. His dreams are to increase his family's savings, to have a quality product and to have a greater economic value. 

In his free time he likes to dance, especially during carnival.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Sorena

texts.en:
This is Sorena, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Amado, a driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sorena operates a food stall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sorena hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Suzzette

texts.en:
This is Suzzette, a 49-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines and married to Alberto, an employee. Together they manage their household, and at this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Suzzette operates a tailoring business that mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing such as uniforms are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Suzzette also sells dried fish for additional income, and her regular customers for both enterprises are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her enterprise.

Suzzette hopes her business grows, and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Waziwou

texts.fr:
Waziwou est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est célibataire.
Waziwou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2009. Il vend des produits d’électricité pour tous clients à domicile. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Waziwou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  des matériaux d’électricité. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Waziwou voudrait devenir un grossiste. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Waziwou is a 30-year-old man. He is single.

Waziwou has been working as a reseller since 2009. He sells electrical products door-to-door to all types of customers. He gets the products in Lomé and works alone. Right now, his main problem is his inability to satisfy all of his customers' demands.

Waziwou has requested his 1st loan from WAGES in order to buy electrical material; he would like to reinvest in his business. In the coming years, Waziwou would like to become a wholesaler. He plans to use his profits to meet his needs.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods.

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr:
Falilatou est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 2 enfants, qui ne vont plus à l’école. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.
Falilatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine et du pure water(eau minérale mise en sachet) pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Falilatou a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et du pure water. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Falilatou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Falilatou is a 45-year old woman. She is a widow and has two children, who have left school. Her first child is 25, and the youngest is 18.

Since 1992, Falilatou has been working as a re-seller. She sells kitchen utensils and pure water (mineral water in bags) to different types of customers at the market. Falilatou buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her biggest challenge is depleted stock.

Falilatou has obtained her second loan from WAGES in order to buy kitchen utensils and pure water. She wants to re-invest in her business.
Over the next few years, Falilatou would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of pure water and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos de 52  años vive (isla  Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es el de tener un bazar y tambien vende perfumes para tener dinero adicional. Le gusta mucho su trabajo y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposa . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia  . a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener su vivienda en buen estado . con el préstamo comprara (perfumes para seguir mejorando sus ingresos)
texts.en: Carlos is 52 years old and lives in Guayaquil. He started his business because it was a good way to make the money he needs to provide for his children. Carlos has a bazaar and he also sells perfumes to make extra money. He likes his work and it has gone well, thank God. He works everyday with help from his wife. In the future he would like to have a bigger business and improve the condition of his house. With the loan he will buy more perfume in order to continue increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Suley Cristina

texts.es: Suley de 30 años  vive (fortin Guayaquil ). Ella decidió prestar dinero para poder tener capital en el negocio del calzado. Le dieron el dinero y se puso su negocio de poco a poco. Ahora le va bien y se dedica a trabajar todos los días sola . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia .a futuro ella anhela mejorar su casa . con el préstamo comprara ( ropa zapatos vitrina ect ).
texts.en: Suley is 30 years old and lives in Fortin, Guayaquil. She requested a loan in order to get the capital she needed to start a her shoe business. She received a loan and has been building her business little by little. It's going well and she works every day by herself. In the future she would like to improve her house. With the current loan, she will buy clothes, shoes and display cases.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and display cases.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 32 years old. She has four children between 5 months and 8 years. 

She wants the loan to add more sugar, flour and sodas in a business that she has been running for the past four years. 

With the profits, she will make savings and improve the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
This is Senia, 47, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eliseo, a security guard, and she is the mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Senia is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her product since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Senia dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, a 32-year-old married mother of two children aged five and eight years, started her tailoring business after realizing she was talented in dressmaking. Her business is within a busy shopping centre, and she currently makes and sells dresses and school uniforms to individual clients and schools.

Having repaid a previous loan of Kes20,000, she is now requesting a new loan for the same amount to buy clothing materials to improve her business. Hannah plans to use the anticipated new profits to buy more machines and hire more employees.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and school uniforms.

loans.name: Akpédzé

texts.fr:
Kafui est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. 
Kafui travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend des cartes de recharge, des articles scolaires et fait de la photocopie pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Kafui a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge, des articles scolaire et des nécessaire pour photocopie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kafui voudrait agrandir la taille de son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kafui is a 31-year-old woman. She is single and has no children.

Kafui has been working as a retailer since 2009. She sells recharge cards and school supplies, and also provides a photocopying service for all types of customers in her shop. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her main problem is her insufficient inventory.

Kafui has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy recharge cards, school supplies and various products needed for her photocopying service; she wants to reinvest in her business.

In the years ahead, Kafui would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use her profits to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards, school supplies and various other products.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Ayawa est une femme âgée de 27 ans. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant de 5 ans qui va à l’école.
Ayawa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des mèches pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock. 
Ayawa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayawa voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a 27-year-old woman. She is single and has a 5-year-old child who goes to school.

Ayawa has been working as a retailer since 2010. She sells hair extensions to all types of customers at the market. She gets her products in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her principal problem is her lack of inventory.

Ayawa has requested her 1st loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions; she wants to reinvest in her business. She would like to increase the size of her business in the years ahead. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice 41 years old, is married to a businessman and blessed with three children ranging from 5 to 12 years old. 

Alice likes the work she does of running a grocery store within a fast growing shopping center known for selling  good fruits and nice cheap clothes. She sells bananas, maize, beans, onions, tomatoes etc. The customers that come to buy from her are local residents and visitors from other towns. She has one employee. 

Alice is facing a business environment of stiff competition within the area. She plans to use her first loan of KES 20,000 to add stock of peas, bananas and maize to attract customers with the stock, and with this she hopes the sales volume will increase. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of goods to supply to retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, maize and peas.

loans.name: Annociathe

texts.en:
Annociathe is 43 years old. She has one child who is two years old. 

She has spent four years selling food such as beans and rice. With the loan, she will expand her business of food selling. 

She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foods to sell.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Since 2010 he has owned an internet café and juice shop. He has 30 years of experience in the juice business, which leads to customer trust. He prepares delicious blends and cocktails highly recommended by his customers.

Ramzi is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a new juicer necessary for his business. Most of Ramzi’s customers are teenagers who spend their time using the internet and chatting with friends. His business is improving with the sandwiches he makes; he adds a joyful atmosphere to his place where you can find anything you want.

Ramzi hopes to expand his business as much as he can in the future to keep his customers and family pleased.

loans.use: to buy a new juicer.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Ameyo est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 2 enfants, qui vont  à l’école. Le premier a 7 ans et le dernier a 5 ans.
Ameyo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des chaussures, des produits de beauté et des sacs de sortie pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Ameyo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures, des produits de beauté et des sacs de sortie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ameyo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ameyo is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to an employee. She has 2 children who both attend school. The eldest is 7 years old and the youngest 5.

Ameyo has been working as a retailer since 2005. She sells shoes, beauty products and 'going out' bags to all sorts of customers at the market. She gets her merchandise in Lomé and works alone. Right now, her principal problem is a lack of inventory.

Ameyo has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes, beauty products and 'going out' bags; she wishes to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes, 'going out' bags and beauty products.

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur Gora vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 40 ans. Il est marié et évolue dans le secteur du transport depuis 7 ans. Il gère un taxi et a choisi son activité par opportunité. Ce qui l’intéresse  ce sont les flux financiers qui sont générés par son activité. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour acquérir  quelques pièces a changer  et en meme temps  retaper son véhicule. Ainsi il pourra augmenter la rentabilité de son taxi, et par conséquent l’augmentation de ses revenus pourra l’aider a mieux prendre en charge les dépenses de son foyer.
texts.en: Gora lives in Senegal and is 40 years old. He is married and has been progressing in the transport field for the past seven years. He runs a taxi and chose his activity because it suited him. His interest is the financial income generated by this activity. He has been a shareholder/member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since June 2011 and is requesting a 500,000 franc loan so that he can acquire several parts and at the same time do up his vehicle. By doing this he can increase his taxi's profitability, and his higher income will thus allow him to cover his household expenses more easily.

loans.use: to buy some parts and do up his taxi

loans.name: Luis Aquiles

texts.es: Luis de 61 años vive (Quevedo Ecuador). El tenía una tienda pero la cerro por el motivo de que se separo de su esposa. A raíz de eso el decidió vender confites y betunar zapatos le va bien esa es la manera de salir adelante tiene 2 hijos ya mayores. la dificultad que él tiene es la enfermedad . a futuro el anhela tener bien su negocio y por el motivo de que perdió una pierna necesita comprar una prótesis para suplantar su pierna . con el préstamo comprara ( silla muletas, caramelos ).
texts.en:
Luis, 61, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He had a store but closed it because he separated from his wife.  Because of this he decided to sell candy and shine shoes.  It is going well for him.  This is the way of getting ahead.  He has two grown children.  The difficulty he has is illness.  In the future he wants his business to do well and, because he lost a leg, he needs to buy a prosthesis to replace his leg.

With the loan he will buy a chair, crutches, and candy.

loans.use: to buy a chair and crutches.

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Codou est une célibataire de 29 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle  pratique la vente de produits cosmétiques depuis 2 ans. C’est par hasard qu’elle a opté pour cette activité. Ce qui l’intéresse  dans cette activité c’est la connaissance des différents produits  qu’elle commercialise. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2011. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit  antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 500 000 prévu pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques  destinés a renforcer le stock de produits dans sa boutique. Son objectif est de relever le niveau de ses bénéfices  et mieux développer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Codou is a single woman who is 29 years old and lives in Senegal. She has been selling cosmetics for two years and she chose this activity by chance. She is particularly interested in getting to know the various products that she sells. She has been a member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC since November 2011 and has already repaid one previous loan. She is now requesting a loan of 500,000 francs so that she can buy cosmetics and build up the stock in her shop. Her aim is to increase her profits and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Gladys Nathalia

texts.es: Gladys de 61  años vive (Portoviejo  Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia y al barrio porque no había tienda cercana.  Ella es viuda   por eso necesita trabajar para poder sustentar a su familia .lo hizo y le va bien. Trabaja todos los días solo tiene 3 hijos menores. La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia. A  futuro ella anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite arroz, lapiz viveres)
texts.en:
Gladys, 61, lives in Portoviejo, Guayaquil.  She decided to go into this business because she wanted to help in the economic situation of her family and in the neighborhood, because there was not a store nearby.  She is a widow so she needs to work to be able to support her family.  She did it and it is going well for her.  She works every day.  She only has three minor children.  The difficulty she has is crime.  In the future she wants to improve her business and have a place.

With the loan she will buy oil, rice, pencils, and supplies.

loans.use: to buy pencils, oil, rice, and provisions.

loans.name: Nexi Karina

texts.es: Nexy  de 22 años vive (guasmo  Guayaquil). Ella anteriormente tenia un cónyuge pero la abandono. Por ese motivo decidió que era mejor tener  su negocio y que las ganancias solo eran para ella y se puso un gabinete gracias a la ayuda de su hermanos . Por ese motivo puso su peluquería y aparte  vende cosméticos. hasta ahora le va bien y se alegra de haber tomado esa decisión. a futuro anhela tener su negocio mas grande y tener personal profesional. Con el prestamo comprara ( tintes y sillón ).
texts.en:
Nexy, 22, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil.  Previously she had a spouse but he abandoned her.  For this reason she decided it was better to have her own business, and for the profits to be for her alone.  Thanks to her siblings she set up an office.  For this reason she installed her hairdressing salon, and she also sells cosmetics.  Up to now it is going well for her, and she is happy she made that decision.  In the future she wants to have a bigger business and professional staff.

With the loan she will buy dye and a chair.

loans.use: to buy dye, scissors, a hairdryer, and a chair.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
This is Renelyn, 31, a resident of Pasay city, Philippines. She is married to Maximo, a mason. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Renelyn operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers, sells the items at a little profit. Her products are men and women’s pants and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy her products due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Renelyn hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies with the group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 56, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Conrado, a driver. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Juanita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons. This is because the costs of buying cooked rice and meats costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juanita dreams to be able to give her all of her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr:
Madame Bineta est âgée  de 54ans. Elle est mariée.  Elle habite au Sénégal  et s’active dans le secteur du 
Commerce. Elle vend des tissus, bazins, fruits, cacahuètes  et elle est en meme temps femme de ménage. Elle a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans son activité de commerce. Son objectif est de diversifier ses sources de revenus. Elle est membre  du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 6 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour  s’approvisionner  en marchandises dans l’un de pays limitrophes du Sénégal. Les crédits qu’elle a l’habitude de contracter lui ont permis de réaliser des bénéfices et de faire des constructions progressivement chez ses parents. Ces constructions lui procurent actuellement des locations  qui lui permettent de mieux gérer ses charges personnelles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bineta is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal and works in small trade. She sells fabrics, bazins, fruits and groundnuts, and she is also a housekeeper. She has over 15 years of experience in sales. Her goal is to diversify her sources of income. She became a member of the local U-IMCEC branch in November 2003 and has already repaid six previous loans. 

She is seeking a loan of 500,000F to stock up on merchandise in a country bordering Senegal. Past loans have allowed her to earn profits and to have her parents’ home expanded gradually. These expansions currently bring her rental income that helps in the management of her personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and various other products for resale.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
This is Arlyn, 34, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, a carpenter. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlyn, maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and ordering for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Arlyn, hopes to grow her business and increase her clients in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
This is Noemi, 57, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Noemi oversees operations of the jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has a jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. She earns PHP1000 everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new tires for the jeepneys, and other maintenance needs for her vehicle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Noemi dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn. They modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
This is Rodolfo, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Sencia, a housekeeper and mother to their three children. The eldest child is already in high school while the other two are in the elementary class. Rodolfo, together with his wife, manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rodolfo operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small household products store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers or basins to the local neighborhood. He drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plastic ware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and other items to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Rodolfo hopes that his business will continue to be successful and he dreams of giving his children a bright future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock needed for his rolling store.

loans.name: Murtuzali

texts.en: Murtuzali is a veterinary surgeon; he treats the animals at the village. Murtuzali is 53 years old. He is married and has four children. He is also engaged in an agriculture business. The scope of his business is sheep & lamb purchase and selling. He has applied for a 1600 AZN to buy sheep and to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase the sheep.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is married and has four children who attend school.  She  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

Prossy sells charcoal from home on retail basis, which she has been doing for eight years. She works seven days a week. She generates additional income selling bananas.

Prossy is requesting a loan for 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to help with the transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Adji

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Adji est âgée  de 46 ans .Elle est célibataire et exerce la profession de femme de ménage depuis 11 ans. C’est grâce  a son salaire qu’elle parvient a subvenir a  ses besoins personnel. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2008. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour réfectionner  la toiture de la chambre qu’elle occupe. Ce financement pourra ainsi donc contribuer a l’amélioration de son cadre de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Adji is a single 46-year-old woman who has been working as a housekeeper for 11 years. Her income allows her to support herself. She became a member of a U-IMCEC branch in December 2008. 

She is seeking a loan of 250,000F to repair the roof of her home. This loan will contribute to the improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She has been selling used clothing for the last five years, and plans to use this loan to purchase more jackets to sell.  

Carolyne hopes to expand her business so that she can offer job opportunities to her community.

loans.use: to pay for more jackets to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school based in Kenema city. This school was founded in 1998. Teachers of the school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. This is the first loan that teachers of the school have benefited from SMT/Kiva lenders. They requested a loan of 16,800,000.00 SLL for the entire group. 

With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot let them do. Emmanuel is the leader of the group. He is forty-five years of age. He was born in Songo Town. He is single and has one child attending secondary school. Emmanuel has been in the teaching profession for nineteen years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like cement, sand, rods, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cements, sand, rods, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Christine est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 17ans et le dernier a 08 ans.
Christine travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des mèches et des tissages pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Christine a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des tissages. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et épargner une partie.
Dans les prochaines années, Christine voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine is a 41-year-old woman. She is married to a mason. She has 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest 8.

Christine has been working as a retailer since 2004. She sells hair extensions and weaves for all sorts of clients in her shop. She buys the products in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her principal problem is a lack of stock.

Christine has requested her 1st loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions and weaves; she wants to reinvest in her business and build her savings. In the coming years, Christine would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use her profits to make sure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Medardo Marcial

texts.es: Medardo de 34 años vive ( isla Guayaquil  ) el empezó a trabajar en un  taller de ebanistería y aprendió mucho de muebles . por lo cual decidió entrar a un curso de ebanista  y ahora se puso su propio taller y le va bien . trabaja todos los días solo y a veces lo ayuda un primo es casado tiene 3 hijos  . la dificultad que tiene esw la delincuencia . a futuro el anhela tener su negocio grande . con el préstamo comprara ( materiales como cinta, cierra, madera ).
texts.en: Medardo, 34, lives on the Island of Guayaquil. He started working in a carpentry workshop and learned a lot about making furniture. He decided to take a carpentry course and now has his own workshop, which is going well. He works alone every day and sometimes his cousin helps him. Medardo is married with 3 children. The difficulty he has with having his business is the petty crime in the area. In the future, he dreams of having his own big business. With the loan he will buy materials such as tape, a saw and wood.

loans.use: buy tape, a saw and wood.

loans.name: Christian Eduardo

texts.es: Cristhian de 33 años vive ( orquideas Guayaquil ) gracias a la ayuda de su mama pudo comprarse un vehículo, escogio esta actividad de taxista porque le parecio muy buena ya que el es muy conocido en su barrio . decidio hacer expreso escolar y le va muy bien .  trabaja todos los dias solo  es casado.a futuro anhela tener una compañia de taxi . con el prestamo compara ( llantas )
texts.en: Cristhian, 33, lives in Guayaquil. Thanks to the help of his mother, he was able to buy a car. He thought it a good idea to become a taxi driver because he is well-known in his neighborhood. He also decided to be the school express and it’s going very well. He works alone every day. He’s married. His dream is to own a taxi company. With the loan, he will buy tires.

loans.use: buy tires.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is single and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda. She operates a beauty salon on retail basis, which she has been doing for four years. She works seven days a week. 

Olivia is requesting a loan for 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics, hair oils, braids, and weaves. Her major business challenges are seasonality and increasing prices of cosmetics. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food. Her goals and aspirations include expansion of her salon business into a bridal salon and building her own house.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of hair oils, cosmetics, braids, and weaves.

loans.name: Laura Edofilia

texts.es:
LAURA EDOFILIA tiene 29 años de edad es soltera tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la madre y los hijos de 8, 7, 4 y 2 años de edad en san Miguel de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC EL CONSUELO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Consuelo y se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

 LAURA EDOFILIA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, maíz, además tiene vacas lecheras. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, balanceado, líquidos para la maleza. Las compras y las ventas lo hace  en San miguel.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar los cultivos y la ganadería. El sueño es poder inculcar a la familia el ahorro, tener un producto de primera y en el negocio tener un buen incremento en la economía.
El desafío al que se enfrenta es el mal clima, muchas lluvias.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y pasear.
texts.en:
LAURA EDOFILIA, 29, is a single mother of 4 children. She lives with her mother and her children, who are 8, 7, 4 and 2 years old, in San Miguel de Bolívar.
She is a member of the VRC EL CONSUELO, which is located in the El Consuelo district. She is an agricultural and livestock farmer.
LAURA EDOFILIA sows blackberries, corn and has some dairy cows.
She’s requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizers, balanced feed for bovines and liquid herbicides. She buys and sells in San Miguel.
With the help of the loan, she’ll be able to increase crops and livestock. Her dreams include getting her family to understand how to save money, having a first-rate product, and in business increasing her income.
The challenges she faces are bad weather and too much rain.
In her spare time, she enjoys playing indoors and taking walks.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizers, balanced feed for bovines and liquid herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Anne M.j. Graciella

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Anne M.J.Graciella est une jeune femme de 31 ans qui évolue dans le secteur de la couture et pratique la confection. Elle a une expérience de 6 ans dans son activité qu’elle a choisie par passion. Ce qui lui plait le plus dans son domaine d’activité c’est l’art et le fait de voir les gens s’habiller bien. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2004. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit  antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une machine a coudre. Elle dispose d’une commande importante et  souhaite l’honorer vis-à-vis de ses clients.
texts.en:
Anne M.J.Graciella, 31 years old, is a young woman who works in the sewing sector and makes clothing. She has six years of experience in this line of work that she chose because it was her passion. What she likes most about this type of work is the artistic aspect and seeing people dress nicely.

She has been a member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC since April 2004. She has already paid back one previous loan.

She is seeking a loan of 150,000 frs to buy a sewing machine. She has a long list of orders that she would like to honor for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es:
El señor Sandro tiene 44 años, está casado con la señora Carolina juntos tienen un hijo pequeño, el señor Sandro es huérfano de padre, esta situación fue muy difícil de asimilar para el cliente ya que ha tenido problemas hasta de su apellido, ya que el padre biológico jamás le dio su apellido, razón por la cual él adora a su hijo y siempre está con él apoyándole en sus estudios y en sus cosas personales. Pues ambos se fueron a trabajar a Estados Unidos donde trabajaba prestando servicios de mecánica y la esposa de niñera y con sus ahorros lograron comprase una casa en la ciudad de Cochabamba 
El señor Sandro y su familia viven al norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba, después de volver de Estado Unidos se dedica a  la compra y venta de vehículos, algunos de dichos vehículos los importa desde Estados Unidos, razón por la cual el destino del crédito es para capital de operación  ya que le falto dinero para la compra de un vehículo que estaba a un precio muy bajo, esta es  una oportunidad para realizar dicha compra ya que al vender tendrá más utilidad.
Entre sus sueños más grandes esta tener un taller grande de mecánica y trabajar en ella y además dar empleo a la gente de nuestro país.
texts.en:
Sandro, 44, is married to Carolina and they have one small child. Sandro is an orphan, which was a very difficult situation for him, especially for administrative and legal purposes because his father never gave him his last name. This is the reason Sandro adores his son and is always with him, supporting him and helping him with his studies and personal things. Sandro and his wife went to the United States to work, he as a mechanic and she as a nanny, and with their savings they were able to buy a house in the city of Cochabamba.

Sandro and his family live in the north part of the city of Cochabamba. After returning from the United States, they started a car sales business. They sometimes import cars from the United States and one car in particular is at a very low selling price, but they don’t have enough money to buy the car. That’s why they’ll be using their loan as business capital, so they can buy this car and sell it at a higher price.

One of his dreams is to own a car repair shop and work in it as a mechanic, and give employment to the people of his country.

loans.use: have business capital to buy a car and then sell it.

loans.name: Silvia De Jesus

texts.es: Silvia de 43  años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia .  la idea de poner ub¿na tienda es de su esposo lo hizo y le va bien . Trabaja todos los días solo . tiene hijos pero ya hicieron su vida. La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia . A  futuro ella anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite arroz, enlatados)
texts.en: Silvia, 43, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She decided to start this business to help her family’s economic situation. Her husband had the idea to open a store, and so she did, and it’s going well. She works alone every day. She has children but they have their own lives. The only challenge she faces is the crime in the area. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and have an actual locale. With the loan she will buy oil, rice and canned food.

loans.use: buy oil, rice and canned food.

loans.name: Abakozi Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie  fait partie du groupe Abakozi et   habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 56 ans. Elle a 5 enfants, dont 4 étudient. Un enfant est à l’école primaire et les trois autres à l’école secondaire. Ils sont âgés   de 5 à 25ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de restaurant depuis 2 ans.

Elle est à son neuvième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des produits non périssables pour son restaurant.
Elle va constituer un stock. Ces produits seront revendus cuits aux clients de façon progressive.

Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettent de nourrir ses enfants.
texts.en: Anastasie is a member of the Abakozi group and lives in Gitega. She is a 56 year old widow. She has 5 children, 4 of whom are still in school. One is in primary school, and the three others in secondary school. The children are aged from 5 to 25. She has been a restaurant trader for the last two years. She is on her ninth loan with Turame. With the KIVA credit she is applying for, she will increase her stock of goods, buying non perishable products for her restaurant. She will build up a stock. These products will be cooked and sold progressively to her customers. The profits from her business allow her to feed her children.

loans.use: to purchase non-perishable supplies for her restaurant. They will be resold, cooked, to customers.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 42 years old. She is a widow with three children who are all enrolled in school. She has been selling used shoes for four years. With the loan she wants to buy more shoes to sell. She plans to use the profits from the business to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sokhna Bintou

texts.fr: Madame Sokhna  Bintou est une femme  mariée de 35 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal.  Elle est vendeuse de savons, de produits pour cheveux et de lait  pour le corps depuis plus de 5 ans. En meme temps elle exerce l’activité de coiffeuse. Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par passion et aussi pour subvenir aux besoins  familiaux.  Ce  sont les bénéfices qu’elle réalise qui l’intéresse  dans son activité de commerce. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 250 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner en mèches  et cheveux naturels qu’elle va revendre aux personnes qui viennent se faire tresser. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sokhna Bintou is a married woman of 35 years of age. She lives in Senegal. She has been selling soaps, hair products and body milk for over 5 years. She is also a hairdresser. She decided on this type of business because she had a passion for it, and so that she could meet her family's needs. She is especially interested in the profits that she makes with her business.

Sokhna Bintou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since December 2003. She has already repaid 2 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 250 000 francs to be used to buy hair extensions and natural hair for resale to people who have come to have their hair plaited. The increase in her profits enables her to improve her family's social living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and natural hair for resale.

loans.name: Agustín Rufino

texts.es: Agustín Rufino de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y frijol, esta última cosecha tuvo más demanda y no dió abasto a sus clientes, por lo que ahora quiere aumentar la producción, todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, siempre está la orden y con amabilidad a sus clientes; es un hombre trabajador dispuesto a lograr grandes éxitos en un futuro, piensa que sus más grandes secretos son la constancia y el amor a su labor, es así como se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de frijol y maíz por mayor para incrementar sustancialmente su cosecha. Agustín Rufino tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Agustín Rufino, 50, lives with his life partner and children in his own house. He is a farmer and sows corn and beans. There was so much demand for his last crop, there wasn’t enough to supply all of his clients. Now, he wants to increase production. Everything he sells is high quality and at a very accessible price, as well, he provides unequalled service as he’s always ready and willing to attend to clients with kindness. He’s a hard-working man willing to achieve great success in the future. He thinks that his greatest secrets are perseverance and loving your work and that’s why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL. With this loan, he will buy bean and corn seeds to substantially increase his crop. Agustín Rufino hopes that by doing this he will be able to give his family a full life.

loans.use: buy bean and corn seeds.

loans.name: Morie's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school based in the city of Kenema. This school was founded in 1992, and the teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek their first loan from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan for 11,400,000 SLL for the entire group, and each member will use his portion to buy or invest in something that their salaries cannot let them do. 

Morie leads the group. He is age 38 and was born in Kalaihun. He is a married to a businesswoman and has two children – one in secondary school and the other too young to go to school yet. Morie has been in the teaching profession for 14 years now and is requesting this loan to invest in a business, which involves buying and selling food items such as palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), rice and other items.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a secondary school in Kenema. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 12,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Thirty-nine-year-old Ibrahim is the leader of this group of teachers. Ibrahim was born in Magburka. He is married and has three children who attend primary school. Ibrahim has been a teacher for thirteen years. He has requested this loan to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc., for the construction of a family house. 

Staff from this school, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish tasks that they would otherwise not be able to on their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc., for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children--all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Shamim operates a beauty salon at the market. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxer, weaves and braids. Her major business challenges are thieves and the transportation of boxes from the city centre to her salon. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked salon and also to make enough profit to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxer, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all in school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income by selling bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land to build rental houses and also to become a wholesaler of bananas. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is married. She is 49 years old. She has been selling different food items, such as beans, bananas and rice in her store for 12 years. She wants the loan to buy more foodstuffs. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 51 years old. She is married with five children. Her husband works as a house builder. With the loan she wants to buy more foodstuffs, such as beans, potatoes, bananas and rice. She plans to use the profits to add new items that she doesn’t have currently in her store. She thinks big for her business and plans to build it in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en: Lucie is 45 years old. She has three children aged between 11 and 27. She sells airtime for a renowned telecommunication company called MTN. She has been doing this business for the past 10 years. She has requested the loan to buy more air time to sell. She will use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more air time to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 56-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and three children. They are all working hard to build a good future and improve their lives. He went into business on his own in the year 2000, selling Lebanese food products such as spices. Now he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more provisions for his business. He’s sure that buying these products will help him increase his income. In the future, he plans to have his own food shop.

loans.use: to buy food to sell from his business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, trabaja como empleado realizando el control de parada de los trufis (trufis son taxis con ruta fija).
El crédito lo necesita para pagar el trámite de su licencia de conducir ya que necesita tener más ingresos para mantener a su familia y con la licencia podrá manejar un trufi y ganar dinero extra.
José, es divorciado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José works as an employee controlling the “trufi” (trufis are taxis with a fixed route) stop.

He needs the loan to pay for the application for his driver’s license.  He needs more income in order to support his family.  With the license he will be able to drive a trufi and earn extra money.

José is divorced and has two children.  He lives with them in the Tembladerani aea of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the application for his driver’s license in order to drive a taxi and earn extra money for his family.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en una humilde vivienda. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de experiencia por lo que saca muy buenas cosechas, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda por parte de su clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precio accesible además el servicio es excelente; Dagoberto es un hombre entregado a su labor siempre dispuesto a aprovechar oportunidades que se le presenten, piensa que el carácter positivo es el que determina tu destino, él tiene ese carácter es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos agrícolas y alquiler de tierra a fin de incrementar su productividad y consecuentemente sus ganancias. Dagoberto tiene la confianza que de esta forma llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Dagoberto, 46, lives with his life partner and his children in a humble abode.
He is a farmer who grows corn. He has many years of experience, which is why he has very good crops. Recently, the demand from his clients has grown. He has a high quality product with an accessible price and impeccable customer service. Dagoberto is a man dedicated to his work, always willing to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves. He thinks that a positive character is what determines your destiny. He has that kind of character so he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL so he can buy agricultural supplies and rent land, in order to increase productivity and consequently, his income. Dagoberto is confident that this will help him provide economic security to his household.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and rent land.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne sells foodstuffs. She is married to a businessman. She is 31 years old. She has been selling beans and sweet potatoes for 13 years. With the loan she will buy more beans and sweet potatoes to sell. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Bockarie A.a's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Kenema. Teachers at this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 9,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve their standard of living. 

Fifty-seven-year-old Bockarie is the leader of this group of teachers. Bockarie was born in a place call Jojoima. He is married and has five children who attend secondary school. Bockarie has been a teacher for thirty-eight years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, robs, etc., for the construction of a family house. 

Staff from this school, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish on their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, robs, etc., for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Asad

texts.en: Asad is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has three children who are all students. Asad wishes to cover his family's expenses as much as he possibly can. Because of that, he works very hard to reach his goals. He started his own business as a car painter in 1992 and has his own garage. Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase a new generator for his business. He will use this loan to improve his work, and thereby earn a higher income. In the future, he plans to enlarge his garage and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase a new generator for his business.

loans.name: Nderagakura Group

texts.fr:
S. Caritas fait partie du groupe Nderagakura et habite à Gitega. Elle est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à Ntibarikanuye. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants, âgé de 10 à 28 ans. Elle a un enfant qui étudie à l’université, deux sont à l’école  secondaire et les autres à l’école primaire. 

Elle fait le commerce de restaurant depuis 4ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des produits stockables (haricot sec, riz,..).Ils seront revendus cuits aux client dans son restaurant, progressivement.
texts.en:
S. Caritas is part of the Nderagakura group and lives in Gitega. She is 46 years old and is married to Ntibarikanuye. Together they have 9 children, aged between 10 and 28 years old. She has one child studying at university, two are in secondary school and the others in primary education.
She has operated a restaurant for the last 4 years. This is her third loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is requesting, she will purchase storable goods (dried beans, rice etc). They will be cooked and sold progressively to customers in her restaurant.

loans.use: to increase her supplies of non perishable goods (dried beans, rice, etc) that will be sold cooked to customers in her restaurant.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana, trabaja como asistente técnica en una empresa privada dedicada a ayuda a la mujer en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de alquileres  por adelantado de la casa donde vive ya que de esta manera reduce su pago mensual y libera fondos para la manutención de su hijo y de ella misma.
Liliana, es divorciada  y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en una casa en alquiler en la zona Mallasa de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Liliana works as a technical assistant for a private company that helps women in the city of La Paz.

The loan that she needs is to make rent payments in advance for the house where she lives.  This way she will reduce her monthly payment and free up funds for living expenses for her son and for herself.

Liliana is divorced and has one child.  They live in a rented house in the Mallasa area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to make rent payments in advance for the house where she lives

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una pupusería en el lugar de su residencia, ha sabido aprovechar cada espacio de su casa de acuerdo a sus necesidades, es muy conocida en el lugar pues las pupusas que elabora son exquisitas y tiene en variedad frijol con queso, queso con loroco, chicharrón, revueltas entre otras, todas hechas con material de primera calidad y las vende a precios accesibles últimamente ha aumentado la demanda y no quiere decepcionar a ningún cliente pues su servicio es el mejor; María es una mujer muy enérgica y entregada a su trabajo siempre está buscando la forma de superarse, piensa que siempre hay que soñar y apuntar más alto de lo que sabes que puedes lograr, ella está viendo alto es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, queso, frijol, chicharrón, verdura todo por mayor para ésta época de verano en donde los clientes estan de vacaciones y en lugar de comer en casa prefieren sus pupusas para cenar o desayunar. Margarita tiene esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita, 54 years old, lives with her children in her own house. She sells 'pupusas' [a popular Salvadoran tortilla wrap] from her residence. Maria Margarita has decided to take advantage of space in her house according to her needs. She is very well known in her location because her 'pupusas' are exquisite and she offers a variety, including beans with cheese, cheese with sausage, and scrambled eggs, among others. All are made with first-quality ingredients and sold at accessible prices. Lately, demand has increased and her service is the best; she doesn't want to turn away any customers.

Maria Margarita is a very energetic woman dedicated to her work. She is always looking for a way to get ahead, convinced that one should always dream and aim higher than we think we can achieve. Maria Margarita is planning ahead, requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to purchase corn, cheese, beans, sausage and vegetables at wholesale for the summer season when customers are on vacation and, instead of eating at home, prefer to buy 'pupusas' for breakfast or supper. Maria Margarita hopes in this way to offer her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy  corn, cheese, beans, sausage and vegetables to cook popular snacks to sell.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is 23 years old and has earned a living selling foodstuffs for the last two years. She would like to improve her business, and is applying for this loan to buy more food items, such as sweet potatoes and bananas, to sell to her customers. She currently rents her business location, and plans to use the profits from this loan to buy a plot of land from which she can run her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, es profesor jubilado y recibe su renta cada mes; también se dedica al comercio de prendas deportivas junto a su esposa.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, arena , estuco y pintura para la refacción de una habitación en su casa para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Mario, es casado y tiene cinco hijos vive  en casa propia en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Mario is a retired teacher, and he receives his pension every month.  He also sells sportswear with his wife.

He needs the loan to buy cement, sand, stucco, and paint to fix up a room in his house.  

He will do this to make his family more comfortable.

Mario is married and has five children.  He lives in his own house in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the third time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stucco, and paint to fix up a room in his house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita, trabaja como empleada en el área de limpieza en una institución pública junto a su esposo, este es el único ingreso que tienen para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo necesita para el terminado de obra fina en su vivienda para  poder vivir más cómodamente, pues actualmente la familia está viviendo en habitaciones que no están terminadas, pues falta poner estuco, pintar y arreglar los enchufes.
Rita es casada y tiene dos hijos, viven en casa propia en la zona Pura Pura en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rita works with her husband as an employee cleaning a public institution.  This is the only income they have to support their family.

She needs the loan to complete the finishing touches on her house.  She wants to do this in order to be able to live more comfortably.  Her family is currently living in unfinished rooms.  They need to stucco, paint, and fix the plugs.

Rita is married and has two children.  They live in their own house in the Pura Pura area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials to complete the finishing touches on her house.

loans.name: David Daniel

texts.es: David de 26 años vive (paraíso Guayaquil). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque anteriormente trabajaba  en algo similar. El se dedica a la venta de Cd alquilas lavadoras y vende agua. Trabaja todos los días con su esposa  tiene 2 hijos. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. a futuro el anhela comprar un carro para su negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( CD,  agua en botella)
texts.en: David, who is 26 years old, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil. He decided to enter into this business because he had previously worked on something similar. He makes his living from selling CDs, renting washing machines, and selling bottled water. He works everyday with his wife. They have two children. The difficulty that they deal with is crime. In the future, he yearns to purchase a car for his business. With this loan he will purchase CDs and bottled water.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and bottled water

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana Lilian vive en una zona muy concurrida de personas, ahí se dedica a la elaboración y confeccción de carteras y gabachas, es muy conocida en el lugar, pues todo lo que realiza es creativo y de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, su clientela siempre queda satisfecha con el trabajo, además el servicio es único. Ana siempre los recibe con gran amabilidad; ella es una mujer emprendedora, muy entregada a su trabajo, con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, piensa que  para ser un gran campeón, tienes que creer que eres el mejor, si no lo eres, haz como si lo fueras, ella ya es una campeona es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela y papel  por mayor.
