This is forty-three-year-old Kaday. She is married, and has three children aged four, six and seventeen. In 2010, Kaday established her provisions business. She began her business to provide the immediate needs of people within the community. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,400,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan for SLL 3,000,000. Kaday has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional milk, ovaltine, sugar, mayonnaise and butter. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Kaday plans to expand to the center of town. She thinks the loan can help to increase her profits. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for sugar, mayonnaise, butter and milk.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Hawa.  She is married, and has two children who are 16 and 8 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help in the business.  In 2002, Hawa established her drinks and provisions business. She began her business to meet the welfare of her children and her personal needs. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional drinks and provisions. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Hawa plans to improve the business and expand. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Subba

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Subba.  He is married, and has three children who are 2, 5 and 8 years old. He has one additional dependent who live with him to help with the house chores.  In 1994, Subba established his used bags business. He began his business to be self-reliant and to meet his family needs. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Subba has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional used bags. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Subba plans to improve the business and move to a shop.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for used bags to sell

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa would like to take a further loan to buy more high quality food for her cattle. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to increase the number of her cows and the quality of meat and to earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the number of cows. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase high quality food for cattle.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is fifty-two years old and married with two sons. She and her husband support their family by selling noodles in the local community. She would like to take a loan to increase the working capital for her business which will enable her to buy better food such as meat, noodles and beverages to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better food such as meat, noodles and beverages.

loans.name: Norovsuren

texts.en:
Norovsuren is a forty-five-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her husband is employed. The oldest child studies at college. She opened a small food shop in 1995 and she has expanded and changed the place several times, searching for new markets. She runs the business in a rented room of the building. She has gained many regular customers. She also runs food cart business with her husband in summertime. 

Norovsuren is a diligent woman who says that "I need some support to buy the supplies for my business as it is becoming summer. I have a further plan to expand and develop my business". The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy the food supplies.

loans.use: To buy food supplies.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. 

Hong earns a living running a general store, which she has done for five years. Hong would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soaps, snack foods, cooking oils and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soaps, snack foods, cooking oils and confectionery to stock her general store.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan, a twenty-eight-year-old widowed woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Xuan has requested a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder and shampoos to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder and shampoos to stock her store.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón, tiene la edad 83 de  años, está casado y vive con sus hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el engorde de pollos y la compra de los mismos. El cuenta con las instalaciones para los pollos y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de los hijos y crecer con le proyecto de cría de pollos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ramón is 83 years old, married, and lives with his children.  He plans to use this loan to purchase feed to fatten his chickens and to purchase more chickens.  He has facilities for the chickens and he wants to give them chicken feed so that they will fatten up more quickly.  He wants his animals to be of an ideal weight so they can be sold in the local market or in markets nearby.  He wants to earn the most income he can for his well-being and that of his children, and so he can grow his project of raising chickens.  

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided this loan with better credit terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Bashiru.  He is married, and has three children aged 4, 7 and 14 years old. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help with the house chores.  In 2010, Bashiru established his patent drugs business. He began his business out of the need to care for the needs of the patients within the community. Working six days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Bashiru requires a loan in order to buy additional medical drugs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Bashiru plans to increase the business and improve on the pharmacy.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for medical drugs

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Enhtaivan is a forty-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her two children study at secondary school and the youngest child goes to kindergarden. Her husband is employed. 

After working as a shop assistant, she had an idea to start her own business. In 2002, she started her garment-retail business. Now she purchases supplies from China and trades them to her regular customers at the market. 

Enhtaivan is a diligent woman who says that "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing supplies in large quantities from China. I am planning to increase the types of clothes and save the transportation expenses". 

The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy the garments.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell from China.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, forty-five, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a motorcycle taxi driver. 

Lien supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business four years ago. She sells snacks, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a mother of four children who is engaged in buying and selling bananas and coconuts in the village. She is patiently doing such activity because of the improvement that it has brought to their lifestyle. Within the two years she has been doing this business, she has learned to save because she has realised the importance of preparing the future.

Presently, she is requesting additional working capital to the amount of 10,000 PHP. It will be use to purchase coconuts and bananas to sell in the market. She is hoping again to get a higher income for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and bananas.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le is requesting a new loan to buy bamboo supplies, accessories and related equipment to produce and sell a larger quantity of bamboo products. Le's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, accessories and equipment to make and sell hand-made furniture and ornaments.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 41-year-old, married woman. She lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 10 years, she and her husband have operated a cafe in front of her house.

Huong would like a loan to purchase beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Huong also hopes that through this loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: To purchase beverages and coffee to stock her store.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is twenty-five years old, single, and resides in Ho Chi Minh City. He works as a seamster and provides sewing services for making garments. Minh started this business activity several years ago and it enables him to earn a sufficient income to cover his daily living expenses. 

Minh is requesting a loan to buy materials to expand his business and increase its turnover. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his activities, increase his income and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand his clothes-making business.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang, fifty-eight, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husbands works as an electrician. 

Sang earns an income running a general store in front of her house. She started this business twelve years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has three children aged 2, 5 and 8 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help the wife with the house chores.  In 2007, Ibrahim established his DVD Player and Cassette business. He began his business to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy additional DVD Players and cassettes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to expand to a big concrete shop. He thinks the loan will help to increase his profit. The competition is high, but the client is able to cope because of his time in the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for DVD players and CDs

loans.name: John B

texts.en: This is 52-year-old John.  He is married and has three children aged 5, 12 and 17 years old  He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help a sister with the education of her child.  In 2010, John established his printing services business. He began his business out of the need to provide learning materials for schools. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. John has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy more printing materials. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, John plans to move the business from a room to a store. He thinks the loan will maximize profits to achieve this.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for printing materials

loans.name: Duzbai

texts.en: Duzbai is a 52-year-old man who lives with his wife in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. He has been running a vegetable planting business since 1990 with his wife. He got his own land for the business and storage of 30 tons underground. He runs the business every season and trades them easily to the customers. His vegetables are always fresh and good. Duzbai is a hardworking man who says that, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the seeds in large quantities. I am planning to increase the sorts and types of the vegetable". The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy the seeds.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Rosalinda has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing (RTWs). She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy different kinds of RTWs to sell.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno is now 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Bayo Iguig. He did not finish his college education so he only provides motorcycle transport services in their village as the source of his income. His parents work as farmers.  From his business, Benigno provides daily meals for the family.  The other part of his daily profit is saved for emergency purposes. 

Benigno would like to strenghten his business, so he is now asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy new pairs of tires, oil and gasoline for his motorcycle.  He promises to pay it back on time.  Someday, with good profits and enough funds, he will establish a small piggery business and keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy ties, oil and gasoline for his motorcycle business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child.

Josephine has a shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 3000 to buy more firewood to sell.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Quoc

texts.en:
Quoc, a 52-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He runs a business that sells a variety of basic household products and flip-flops to people in the local community.

Quoc requests a loan to purchase more products to sell, such as orchid pots, clothes hangers and flip-flops to stock his store. This will enable him to offer a better range of products to his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and he can earn additional income to reinvest in his shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: buy orchid pots, clothes hangers and flip-flops to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 32-year-old married woman with a son. She lives with her husband and son in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hong has been running a food stall for nearly two years. She sells Hue noodles and sugar cane juice to people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demand.   She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: buy food to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 48 years of age and is engaged in selling snacks that are made of malagkit (rice cakes) for over four years. When she started this kind of business, she already had the desire to continue for the reason that her customers are always looking for her delicious native cakes.  

Teresa is earning good income with her business because of her ability to make delicious food for sale. With her willingness to offer a variety of delicious rice cakes, she is requesting a loan 15,000 pesos to buy malagkit, milk, sugar, coconut milk and oil to make more cakes for sale. She hopes for the additional income to enable  the improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy malagkit, milk, sugar, coconut milk and oil

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo is a farmer who raises his family in a village. He cultivates their farm lots and raises livestocks to sell. He aims to improve their status of living and to educate his three children and give them a bright future. Primitivo has been a farmer for almost 22 years, earning a profits of PHP 16,500 from his farming business.  He utilizes his income for their daily consumption and allowances for his children.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Primitivo aims to strengthen his hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and materials needed to improve the pig pen. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will be able to make an improvement in his business.

loans.use: buy feeds, vitamins and materials to improve his pig pen

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan, 35 years old, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Nhan supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. She began this business six years ago. 

Nhan intends to take a loan to increase her clothes production by buying additional materials. This will enable her to increase her income. She hopes her business will run smoothly, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her clothes production by buying additional materials.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is 32 years old and married with one daughter. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Sang and his wife earn money by making shoes at their house. They started their business nine years ago. 

Sang intends to take a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity of materials to increase his production of shoes to sell to his customers. 

Sang hopes his business will run smoothly, which will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of materials to increase his production of shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau is a 35-year-old, married woman who resides in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and son. She and her husband make money by running a business of buying and selling fabric and gloves. From this business, Sau is able to support her family. 

Sau is asking for a loan to buy more fabric and gloves. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to improve her financial situation and upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and gloves.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is a forty-three-year-old married man. He lives with his two children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns money by operating a general store selling miscellaneous items for people in the local community. For the last four years, Linh has supported his family by providing an air-pumping service to inflate rubber tires and by helping his wife to run the general store.

Linh would like a loan to restock his general store with a variety of foods, beverages and basic goods. He would also like to purchase better quality products at competitive prices from wholesalers. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: To restock his store with better quality products at competitive prices from wholesalers.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is forty-two years old and is married. She has three children and lives with them and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard for a school. 

She has run a general store at her house for four years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and she intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a forty-eight-year-old and is the mother of two children. She lives with her children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports family through a business of selling wasted materials for recycling. She has been running a general store for the last eight years. 

Thuy is requesting support in order to purchase products like sugar, butter, soap, toilet paper, beans and other staple products which will help her to have better earnings. Thuy hope that the increasing income will cover household costs and give a better quality of life to her children and help her to get ahead with her plan of expanding her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase products like sugar, butter, soap, toilet paper, beans and other staple products.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is fifty years old and single. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Hoa runs a business selling beverages to earn a living. 

Hoa began her business ten years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of different beverages to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. He is the father of four children who are aged between nineteen and twelve. The youngest three are still schooling. He is himself aged forty-eight and has been in active farming for ten years. He gets additional income from his work as a security officer in a nearby secondary school. His farm produces milk and tea for the local market.

Joseph has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo,a partner of Kiva to help him buy a dairy cow. He believes the additional dairy cow will help increase his milk output and give better living standards for the entire family.

He says lack of funds to do farming in a more commercial way is the major undoing. He is glad though Juhudi Kilimo is mitigating the challenge.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bonathan

texts.en: Bonathan is a 55-year-old man who lives with his wife in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. He has been running a vegetable planting business since 1998 with his wife. He plants them on his own and has storage of 20 tonnes underground. He trades different sorts of vegetable at the local market. He is improving the household and trying hard to make the business the best. Bonathan is a hardworking and outspoken person who says that, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing some necessary seeds. I always try to be careful with my business and supply good and fresh vegetable to the customers". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy the vegetable seeds for the business.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon has been selling bananas and other fruits in the market for over three years. She is working for the improvement of her family's poor living situation. She was raised in hardship and so she is working to so that their lifestyle can improve. She doesn't want her children to experience similar difficulties in life. 

Consequently, Corazon is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy additional products to sell such as vegetables, coconuts and bananas. With her patient and hard work selling variety of goods, she hopes to be able to make their living situation much better and healthier.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell such as vegetables, coconuts and bananas.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is from the village of Libag Sur, where she sells grocery items and acquires profits from them. During the more than ten years that she has been running this kind of business, she has sent her children to school and covered their daily allowances. Now they have their own employment. She had five children and trained them all to be responsible and thrifty.

Veronica's retail business is operating well, but she still needs additional merchandise to sell. Veronica has many competitors in this kind of business. So, she is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, breads, and noodles to sell to her customers.

Someday, she hopes to achieve continuous improvements in her business and to their lives as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, breads, and noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Milarose

texts.en:
Mila Rose is in the business of selling bananas in the market. It is the only source of income of the family so she is is very concerned about her business. With the help of her children, she is trying to boost the business. This also helps to improve their living situation. 

So to keep on reaching for a good life, she is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 as additional working capital to buy bananas to sell in the market. She hopes for higher income this time.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 42 years old and married to Emily. They are blessed with three children.

George sells chickens in Githurai. He has been in this business for the last three years and earns an income of KES 30,800 per month. 

George hopes to grow his business so he can provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase chicken and sausages for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 39 years old and married to a farmer named Rudy. She is in the business of selling bananas. She needs additional capital to buy bananas to sell. A loan amount of PHP 5,000 will be a great help to her business. Josephine thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a kind mother. She is 50 years old and married with four children, two of whom attend school. To provide for her family's daily allowances, Rose cooks food and snacks and sells them to the people in their village. She has been in this business for more than three years now. 

Rose would like to ask for additional capital to buy ingredients such as meat and eggs as well as new kitchen utensils to use in her food-selling business. Someday, she hopes to establish a mini-restaurant to conveniently meet all her customers' demands for the delectable meals and friendly service she offers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat and eggs as well as new kitchen utensils to use in her food-selling business.

loans.name: Kijole

texts.en: Kijole is a 50-year old, widowed woman with four children. She sells fuel and also weaves mats and sells them from her home to the local residents. She has been in this business for the last three years. She cites seasonality as her major challenge and aspires to open a shop to sell fuel. She will use the loan of KES 35,000 to buy fuel to sell in her business. Kijole owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She says food is her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: to buy fuel for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking mother of two children. Since she is a widow, she stands as mother and father of her children. She strives to send her children to school and finish their education. 

Imelda runs a sari-sari (convenience) store business where she sells drinks and bread. Imelda wishes to extend the products she sells in her store. However, she doesn’t have enough capital to do this. Imelda is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy grocery items such as spices, canned goods and snack foods.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as spices, canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old married man. His wife, Esther, is a farmer. He and his wife are blessed with two children.

He has been running a stationary shop for the past ten years. On average, he earns a monthly income of approximately 15,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He explains that he successfully repaid the previous loan. Peter would like to use the loan proceeds to buy a stock of pens, books, printing paper, and plain paper. With the anticipated profits that he will generate from the business as a result of the loan, he will educate his children. In the future, he hopes and dreams of buying an exam printing machine.

loans.use: to purchase additional pens, books, and paper

loans.name: Martias

texts.en:
Martias is a 24-year-old single businessman, though he also supports his parents.

He has been running a spare parts business for the past year. By doing so, he earns approximately 10,000 KES per month, which he uses to pay for his basic living needs.

After being recently introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member, he is now applying for his first loan from KADET LTD. Martias would like to use the loan proceeds to buy additional spare parts for his business. With the anticipated profits that he will generate from the business as a result of the loan, he would like to expand and improve his business. His hopes and dreams are to save and continue with his education.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for his business

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 49-year-old married businesswoman. She is married to Samuel, a businessman. They are blessed with three children, who are 9, 15, and 19 years old.

For the past 12 years, she has been running an electronic goods' outlet shop. By doing so, she is able to earn a monthly income of approximately 13,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD. She explains that she successfully repaid her previous loan. Jennifer would like to use the loan proceeds to buy electrical wires and cables for re-sale purposes. With the anticipated profits she will generate from the business as a result of the loan, she would like to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business to generate additional income.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods (e.g., electrical wires and cables) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with eight children. 

Oliva has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. 

She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Oliva has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Oliva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rosieberg Joy

texts.en:
Rosieberg Joy is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosieberg Joy has a shop that sells a variety of flowers. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to buy a variety of flowers like roses and gerbera.

Rosieberg Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rosieberg Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of flowers

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 57 years old and a widow. She has six children. To earn a living, she pours out her skills and passion in cooking and selling food for daily meals and snacks. It serves as a source of her income. She usually earns about PHP 300 a day in this business. For additional income, she raises hogs to sell in the future. She would like to cook more delicious foods but she needs additional capital so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy meat, eggs, and other ingredients used in the business. 

Someday, she hopes to make her food-selling business more profitable and keep sustaining all her customers' demand for the delicious food she sells. Additional revenue generated from the business will be saved for emergency purposes. She also would like to strengthen her small hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, and ingredients used in cooking food to sell.

loans.name: İmamverdi

texts.en:
Imamverdi is married and has one child.

Imamverdi provides tractor services to farmers. He has also been engaged in agriculture and farming; specifically, he sells hay and grain in the yard of his house.

He is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN to buy new wheels for his tractor so that it will operate better. In the future, Imamverdi hopes to expand both his farming and tractor businesses so that he can generate more income and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase new wheels for his tractor.

loans.name: Songa Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children. Her children go to school.

She has been selling charcoal for six years now. She explains that she works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This would be her tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she successfully repaid, to pay for her children's school fees, household expenses, a plot of land, and additional sacks of charcoal. She is seeking this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, named "Songa." The group is made up of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is thirty-six years old, married, with two children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for ten years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is forty-two years old and married with eight children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Magdalena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Magdalena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is twenty-six years old and married with three children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Elsie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Juliana requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
After successfully repaying her previous loans, Philomena is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will pay for labor. Her hopes and dreams are to continue farming and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Ma. Emma works hard to support her family. She has a firewood sales business in the Philippines and earns additional income from trisikad and motorcycle transport. 

Ma. Emma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell in the market. She has been sustaining her business activities using her previous three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell in the market.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando tiene 40 años, estudio tan solo el nivel bachillerato esta a causa de los recursos limitados de su familia, es por esto que el empezó a trabajar de ayudante desde muy joven en lo que se refiere al servicio de entretenimiento (amplificación). Ahora el esta conviviendo con la señora Bernardina de 36 años, con la cual tienen dos hijos, ambos son menores de edad y están cursando el nivel primario en una escuela fiscal de la zona donde radica, actualmente la familia vive mas de ocho años en la zona de la Chimba en una casa en alquiler, donde tan solo ocupan dos habitaciones para cuarto y cocina, lo restante lo ocupa otra familia que también vive en alquiler. El señor Fernando después de ser ayudante en el servicio de entretenimiento (amplificación) se independiso y se compro los equipos de sonido ahora trabaja los fines de semana que son a veces los viernes, sábados y domingos de 6 a 8 horas por día, como esta actividad son solo fines de semana el señor Fernando trabaja también de agente de seguridad de lunes a viernes. Actualmente le colabora su esposa ya que trabaja de repostera en una empresa cerca de su casa, pero no es muy bien pagada. El señor Fernando esta pidiendo el crédito para comprar y mejorar su equipo de sonido para la amplificación, de esta manera podrá tener mejores ingresos y su esposa ya no trabajara y atenderá mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando, 40, finished high school but couldn’t continue because his family had very limited resources. That’s why he started working at a very young age as an assistant in what’s referred to as entertainment (amplification) services. He is currently living with Bernardina, 36, and they have 2 children, both in elementary school in the area where they live. The entire family has lived over 8 years in the Chimba area, occupying 2 rooms, bedroom and kitchen, in a rented house and the rest of the house is rented by another family.
After being an assistant in entertainment (amplification) services, he became independent, bought his own amplification system and now works on weekends, usually Friday, Saturday and Sunday for 6 to 8 hours a day. Since this job is only on the weekend, he is also a security guard from Monday to Friday. His wife helps with the expenses since she works at a bakery, but she’s not very well paid.
Fernando is requesting a loan to buy a better sound system for amplification so he can generate more income; with more income, his wife won’t have to work outside the home and will be able to focus on the children.

loans.use: buy a sound system for amplification.

loans.name: Menarda

texts.en:
Menarda is 45 years old and married, and two of her four children are in school. 

Menarda is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for five years.

Menarda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Marcet

texts.en:
Marcet is 32 years old and married, and her three children are all in school. 

Marcet is a very hard working entrepreneur, and she has a coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Marcet requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell to customers.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and she works hard to support her family. 

Porferia requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 24, is married with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. 

Christine requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more cothing to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn, 49, is married with 14 children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 22 years.

Ma. Evelyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her furniture making business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for furniture making.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, 51, has eight children between the ages of 7 and 27, all of whom attend school. Florence sells fish, and she has been in this business for 14 years. 

Florence requested a loan to buy more fish for sale. She plans to use the profits to invest in a similar business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marilyn has been farming vegetables for five years now and has previously borrowed from NWTF six times to sustain her business.

Marilyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and a variety of seeds for her vegetable garden. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 47 years old and a mixed-crop farmer. She and her husband James, a business man, are blessed with four children. Norah has been farming bananas for the past five years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES that she uses to support her family.

After being introduced to the company by a staff member, Norah is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to pay school fees for her daughter. With the anticipated profit from the banana growing business, she will buy fertilizer for her farm. 

Her hope is to export her banana products, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock more clothing and be able to complete a large order that they received.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.es:
La señora Constancia tiene 48 años de edad vive en la zona de lato san Pablo del municipio de Chimore del departamento de Cochabamba, concubina y con tres hijos para atender y mantener trabaja en el Chaco y siempre se considero sola. 
Constancia es muy trabajadora y de carácter pasivo ella solicita un crédito para la construcción de una casa en su lote lo que le dará la posibilidad de alquilarla y recibir mas  ingresos. se le hablo del crédito Kiva y le pareció muy oportuno ahora que ella puede pagar de a poco ya que su esposo es mayor de edad y el esta enfermo de la cabeza no tiene un comportamiento regular la señora Constancia trato con varios especialistas y no tuvo éxito con ninguno incluso con curanderos, por eso que solo ella es quien se encarga de su familia incluso ayudando a su pareja en su necesidades. La casita que construirá le servirá para que alquile y así podrá ayudarse en su chaquito la producción es moderada pero se alegra mucho que los créditos Kiva le favorecen a ella, Constancia sueña con que algún día su producción incremente y pueda tener de mas tranquilidad en su parcela agrícola.
texts.en:
Constancia, 48, lives in the San Pablo area in the Chimore municipality of the department of Cochabamba. She’s a concubine with 3 children to attend to and maintain. She is a farmer who works the land and always considers herself alone.
Constancia is hard working and of a passive character, she is requesting a loan to build a house on her lot, which she could rent out to generate more income. She was told about a Kiva loan and thought it was an opportunity now that she can pay it off little by little, since her husband is a senior and not well neurologically. His behavior has become irregular and Constancia has taken him to see many specialists, with no results, even shamen. Now, she is the one in charge of the family, including taking care of her partner’s needs. The house she will build will be a rental and that way she’ll be able to help herself. The crop production on her piece of land is moderate, but she is happy that the Kiva loan will support her. Constancia dreams of increasing the crop production on her parcel of land, so she can feel more at peace.

loans.use: build a house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 36-year-old, businesswoman, she is married to Peter a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling cereals for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from  KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Josephine will use the loan to buy further stocks of dry maize, beans and wheat grams for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a greengrocer's business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat grams for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos Enrique, vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo, al que ayuda y apoya en su educación junto a su pareja, la vida le dio la oportunidad de poder estudiar pero no termino la colegiatura, por los bajos recursos con los que contaban sus padres, hace 6 años que esta afiliado a la Cooperativa de mototaxista, donde presta su servicio como transportista en Mototaxi, donde la gente acude a solicitar este servicio para transportarse, con esta actividad ayuda a su pareja a incrementar sus ingresos familiares, para poder darle una mejor educación a su pequeño hijo, la herramienta de trabajo con la que actualmente cuenta, tiene algunos desperfectos mecánico, por tanto el ha decidido, cambiarla por una nueva que le traerá menos problemas,  es por esta razón que solicita un crédito, para poder comprarse una nueva motocicleta, asi podrá continuar su trabajo diario.
texts.en: Carlos Enrique has one child whom he helps and supports in his education along with his partner. Life gave him the opportunity to study but he didn’t finish his studies because of his parent’s limited resources. He’s been affiliated with the Mototaxi Cooperative for the last 6 years, where he offers his transportation services in mototaxi and people solicit his services to be taken places. With this work, he helps increase the household income along with his partner’s, in order to give his young son a better education. The tool he counts on for work, has a few mechanical issues so he has decided to exchange it for a new one that will bring him less problems. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle so he can continue his daily work.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle in order to offer transportation services.

loans.name: C 1265 Duterimbere Iii Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 35 years old and is married with three children aged between five and twelve years old and she takes care of five relatives. She sells second-hand clothes and she has been in this business for six years. Francoise is a leader of the group "C 1265 DUTERIMBERE III"; she is the second person from the left in the picture. She currently employs one person to help her.

Francoise has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she hopes to have a big boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all her children are in school. She takes care of two additional family members. She operates a restaurant from home on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seventeen years. She works six days a week. 

Rose has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bananas, rice, beef and serving utensils.  She generates additional income through frying cassava chips.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations include owning a fully stocked restaurant and also building her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, rice, beef and serving utensils.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 56 years old a mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Mercy. They are blessed with three children. He has been employed as a vet and also practices farming as another source of income for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a staff member. Charles will use the loan to buy goat feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will buy seedlings and fertilizer.  His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy goat feed.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She is 43 years old and has five children, who are in school.

Rosalia has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Rosalia has requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, pants, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Rosalia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 54 years old and has six children.  She is married and has three children, who are in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been hog-raising for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rochel

texts.en:
This is Rochelle, 33, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rochelle operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth sachet of cooking oil or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viand in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rochelle hopes her business will grow in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Stellar

texts.en:
Stella is a 33-year-old, businesswoman.  She is married to Samuel, a businessman. They are blessed with three children.  She has been selling milk for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Stella will use the loan to buy milk cans and refrigerator. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy milk cans and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living through an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Angeline is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

Angeline has been abaca weaving for five years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 37 years old and married with two children. She does tailoring to earn a living.  She has been in the business for eight years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since Lydiah joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 71,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sewing machine and material for clothes.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and material for clothes.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is a 40-year-old businesswoman.  She is married to Francis, a businessman.  They are blessed with two children. She has been running a retail shop for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying her first loan successfully.  Philis will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
This is Kristina, 24, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Jeffrey, a laborer, and a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while also operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Kristina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Kristina hopes her business would grow in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Edenita

texts.en:
With her dreams to succeed, Edenita always find a way to achieve her dreams. Edenita is 53 years old, married and has one child. Edenita’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in their fields. 

Edenita engages in a meat vending business in the market. She sells pork, chicken and beef on her stall in the market. Edenita has been eight years in this type of business and usually earns PHP 5,000 a month. 

Edenita wishes to gain a greater income from the business to further support sending her child to school up to college. She is requesting for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional meat to sell in the market. She believes that through the loan she is able to increase her income and will continue to send her child in school and finish college.

loans.use: to buy additional meat to sell in the market.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
la ampliación y remodelación de su oficina de turismo fue llevada a cabo satisfactoriamente y el crédito fue cancelado con antrioridad al plan de pagos.
El crédito actual lo requieren para la ampliación de una habitación en su vivienda para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Sandra, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Se ha cambiado de domicilio desde la anterior vez que solicitó un crédito en Kiva, porque consiguió un mejor lugar para vivir.
Es la quinta vez que la cliente trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
The expansion and remodeling of Sandra's tourism office has been carried out satisfactorily, and the loan has been paid back in advance of the planned payments.

She is requesting the current loan for expanding a room of her home, which will provide more comfort for her family.

Sandra is married and has two children with whom she lives in her parents' house in San Pedro in La Paz city.

This is the fifth time that the client is working with IMPRO, and her second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of expanding a room in her home.

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
Damián, trabaja como chofer propietario dentro de un sindicato de trufis en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar cemento, arena y ladrillos para la refacción de una habitación en su vivienda, para tener más comodidad.
Damián, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la  segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en: Damián works as a driver/owner within one of the city of La Paz’s cooperative minibus syndicates.  He needs the loan to buy cement, sand and bricks to upgrade a room at home to have more comfort.  Damián is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and second with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual, recibe una renta de jubilación y actualmente se dedica a la ganadería para tener ingresos para mantener a su familia. Pascual cria ganado vacuno y luego lo vende.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y otros insumos necesarios para  la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda para poder dar comodidad a su familia.
Pascual, es casado y tiene seis hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Pascual receives a retirement pension and also works raising livestock to earn money to support his family.  Pascual raises cattle that he then sells.

He needs the loan to buy cement, sand, bricks and other supplies needed to build a room in his house to provide more comfort for his family.

Pascual is married and has six children he lives with in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks to build a room in his house.

loans.name: María Asunción Del Calvario (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Asunción  Del Calvario  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho, ellos están en su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que el crédito anterior les ayudo mucho es por eso que hay más personas que ingresaron en este ciclo esperando tener éxito con los créditos,  la mayoría del grupo pudo mejorar sus negocios y su vida, ya que con las ganancias pudieron hacer mejoras tanto en sus hogares como ayudarse para los estudios de sus hijos. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señorita Mariuxi, tiene 23 años de edad, está soltera y a vive con los padres y con varios hermanos menores.
 
Ella es una joven muy trabajadora que para obtener algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a  sus padres en los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, de lunes a sábado trabaja en un local donde venden zapatos en el centro de la ciudad.  En sus momentos libres también se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias por catalogo, con lo cual obtiene algo adicional a lo que gana en su trabajo, estas ventas las realiza en las noches y fines de semana, lleva más de 1 año con este negocio y le va bastante bien. 

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para  comprar zapatos y sandalias. Es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y  le gusta por la ayuda que les da el banco a todo el grupo.
 
Sus metas son tener  su propio almacén. 

La foto pèqueña es de un socio que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The María Asunción Del Calvario communal bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the rich historic culture that its mountains surround.

This is a group of people who decided to join together and form this communal bank, which has served them well. They are in their second cycle in the communal bank, and they tell us that the previous loan helped them a lot. This is why there are more people who joined in this cycle hoping to have success with the loans. The majority of the group were able to improve their businesses and their lives, since with the earnings they were able to make improvements to their homes as well as helping their children's educations. They engage in various activities such as business, services, and food sales, among others.

In this place we meet Mariuxi, 23 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and various younger siblings.

She is a very hard-working young woman who works in business in order to earn something on her own and to be able to help her parents with the household expenses.  Monday through Saturday she works in a store in the center of the city where they sell shoes. In her free time, she also sells shoes and sandals through a catalogue, from which she earns something in addition to what she earns at her job. She makes these sales at night and on the weekends. She has been in this business for more than a year, and it is going pretty well for her.

She will use this loan to buy shoes and sandals. This is her second cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because of the help that the bank gives to the entire group.

Her goal is to have her own store.

The small photo is of a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals

loans.name: 3 De Noviembre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 11 socias  del Banco Comunal 3 de Noviembre. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Paula, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 20, 17  y 11 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su marido trabaja en una peluquería.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa y madre que para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus hijos en los gastos de sus estudios se dedica a la preparación y venta de postres y pastelillos, entrega estos  productos todos los días en un centro de salud de la localidad. También prepara sus bocadillos para fiestas o recepciones pero bajo pedidos, Tiene 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, azúcar, huevos y otros víveres necesarios para preparar sus bocadillos. Este es su primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos, ella espera cumplir bien para seguir adelante en el banco.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean unos muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the Andrés De Vera parish of the city of Portoviejo, the 3 of November Comunal Bank members meet up every fifteen days.  The same women who make a living through diverse activities such as trade in general and services among other things.

Here we met Señora Paula, 40 years old, who is married and from this relationship has three children of the ages 20, 17, and 11.  The older two study in university and the younger is in high school.  Her husband works in a barbershop.

She is a great housewife and mother who, in order to earn something on her own and with this help her children with the expense of their studies, makes a living with the preparation and sale of cakes and pastries.  She delivers these products every day to a health center in the town.  She also prepares her snacks for parties or receptions, but through orders.  She has spent 11 years making a living with this activity and it is going very well.

This loan is for buying flour, sugar, eggs, and other food supplies needed to make her snacks.  This is her first cycle in the Communal Bank and she likes it for the ease of getting loans.  She hopes to perform well in order to move forward in the bank.

Her dream is to see that her children become very good professionals.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, and other food supplies.

loans.name: Miriam Francisca

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

La señora Miriam es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio, tiene 40  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 14 y 10 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días ya es en esos días que llegan los pescadores de alta mar y es allí que aprovecha de hacer la mayoría de sus ventas. Nos comenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y los cosméticos. Lleva tres años dedicada a este negocio.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que con el anterior le fue muy bien y ahora espera mejorar aun mas su negocio, nos cuenta que para ella los créditos son muy importantes ya que es así como se financia y las ganancias que obtiene siempre las invierte en comprar cosas necesarias para sus hijos en sus estudios y en esta ocasión le sirvió para medicinas ya que uno de ellos enfermo y gracias a las ganancias pudo pagar los gastos de médicos y medicinas. Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. 

Sus sueños son arreglar su casa ya que aún le falta.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Mar communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular year-round with tourists from around the country and abroad. In this place, the majority of the inhabitants fish or make their living from the sea.

Miriam is a founding member of the communal bank. She likes it because she funds her business with the loans. She is 40 years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children aged 10, 14, and 18. The two younger children are in primary and secondary school. All of her children still live at home. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife, but in order to obtain resources of her own she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories). She sells door-to-door and she works three days a week. She leaves her products on credit and collects every two weeks, since it is on those days that the deep-sea fisherman arrive, and that is when she takes the opportunity to make the majority of her sales. She tells us that perfume and cosmetics are what she sells the most. She has had this business for three years.

She is taking another loan because the previous one went very well for her and now she hopes to improve her business even more. She tells us that for her the loans are very important, since this is how she finances herself, and she always uses the earnings she receives to buy necessary items for her children's education. This time she used it for medicines, since one of them got sick, and thanks to her earnings she was able to pay for the medicines and the doctors' bills. This loan is for buying perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other products.

Her dream is to fix up her house, since it still needs some finish work.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 25 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to John who is also a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a member of KADET staff. Caroline will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: 23 De Noviembre (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 23 de Noviembre se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Este es un grupo de 13 socias y 1 socio que decidieron unirse hace 4 meses  atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho para aumentar sus negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio. Es la presidenta del grupo de crédito y está muy contenta en este su segundo ciclo en el banco comunal ya que con los créditos pudo mejorar mucho su negocio.

Ella para ganarse la vida y poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos hace varios años puso un pequeño bazar en su casa en el cual vende ropa, zapatos, perfumes y varios productos más, allí también poco a poco fue implementando el servicio de internet con el crédito anterior, así pudo hacer realidad sus sueños y  le está dejando buenos ingresos, allí trabaja en compañía de sus hijos cuando ellos no están en sus estudios, trabaja todos los días y nos cuenta que no se le hace difícil ya que el negocio lo tiene en casa, ella compra la mercadería en Guayaquil, ciudad a ala que viaja de una a dos veces al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, etc. para implementar su negocio.

La foto pequeña es del socio que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 23 de Noviembre ("November 23rd") Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Jocay neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are popular year-round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is a group with 13 female members and one male member. They decided to join together and form this credit group four months ago, and so far it has served them well in helping to expand their businesses. The members work in a variety of areas, such as general commerce, food sales, services, and other jobs.

Nelly, who is 34 years old, lives in this city. She is a single mother with 13 and 11 year-old children who attend high school. She is the president of the credit group and is very happy to be in the communal bank's second loan cycle, since the loans can help her to improve her business.

Nelly set up a store in her house several years ago, in order to earn a living and provide her children with what they need. She sells clothing, shoes, perfumes, and various other products. Little by little, she has also been installing Internet service thanks to her last loan. This way, she has been able to make her dreams a reality and she is earning good income. When her children aren't in school they work with their mother. Nelly works every day and tells us that it is not difficult since the business is in her house. She buys merchandise in Guayaquil, a city where she travels one or two times a month, depending what she needs. 

This loan is for buying clothing, shoes, perfumes, etc. for her business.

The small photo is of a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Shirley Maribel

texts.es:
