El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace poco y aun no tiene hijos pero espera muy pronto tener un bebé. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad hace unos años atrás, como siempre le ha gustado ganarse algo por su cuenta es así que con lo aprendido en la academia de belleza en la actualidad se dedica a realizar trabajos de arreglo personal y belleza, ella trabaja tanto en su casa como a domicilio y realiza diversidad de trabajos como cortes de cabello, tinturados, pintado de uñas, entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que a ella sus clientes la llaman por teléfono y al rato ella las visita para realizarles los trabajos que ellas necesitan. Lleva más de 5 años realizando esta labor y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para  comprar tintes, esmaltes y ciertas herramientas que aún le faltan como cepillos, tijeras entre otros productos. Lleva cuatro años en el   Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos en relación  a los otros bancos.
 
Sus sueños son tener algún día un gran salón de belleza
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular year-round with tourists from around the country and abroad. In this place, the majority of the inhabitants fish and make their living from the sea.

In this place lives Shirley, 23 years old. She has been in a common-law marriage for a short time, and still has no children, but she hopes to have a baby very soon. Her husband is a fisherman.

She learned beauty at an academy in the town some years ago, since she has always liked to earn something of her own. This is why, using what she learned at the beauty academy, she currently does personal appearance and beauty work. She works in her home as well as in her customers' homes, and she does a variety of jobs such as haircuts, hair dyeing, and painting nails, among others. She tells us that her customers call her on the telephone and later she visits them to do the work that they need. She has been doing this work for more than 5 years, and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy dyes, nail polish, and certain tools that she still needs such as brushes, scissors, and other products. She has been in the communal bank for four years, and she likes it because the interest rates are low compared to the other banks.

Her dream is to one day have a great beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polish, brushes, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Batiykul

texts.ru:
Батыйкул 58 лет, вдова, воспитала 5 детей. Батыйкул 30 лет проработала учителем физики в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для семьи, в 1996 году начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На данный момент в хозяйстве Батыйкул  имеется  дойная корова, 5 овец и 2 лошади. Также, семья Батыйкул возделывает 3,20 га земли, где выращивает клевер, служащий кормом для собственного скота.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батыйкул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Батыйкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Batiykul is 58 years old, a widow and raised five children.  She worked as a physics teacher at the local school for 30 years and, to provide an additional source of income for her family, started her own business in animal husbandry and farming in 1996.  The business, started with an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS), today yields about 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Currently, Batiykul's business contains a dairy cow, five sheep and two horses.  Her family also works on 3.20 hectares of land and grows clover, which serves as feed for their own livestock.  In order to further develop her business, Batiykul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into increasing her livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Раджаб женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов, а также купле- продажей скота. Получив займ он хочет расширить скотоводство, и с этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота. В бизнесе помогают жена и взрослые дети. Раджаб надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Rajab is married and a responsible father of four children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and also in buying and selling livestock for over 15 years.  Having obtained the loan, he wants to expand his animal husbandry business and is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy livestock.  His wife and adult children help him with the business.  Rajab relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Более 20 лет Зафар занимается земледелием и скотоводством. Он трудолюбивый человек, который женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Зафар любит работать на земле и он выращивает картошку. Часть урожая идут на семейной нужды, а остальную часть продает на рынке. Отходы от выращивания культур идут на корм скота. Зафар запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Zafar has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for over 20 years.  He is a hardworking person, who is married and has two children.  Zafar loves to work on the land and grows potatoes.  Part of the harvest goes toward the family's needs, and the rest of it is sold.  The leftovers from growing crops go toward livestock feed.  Zafar is requesting this loan to buy livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Leyter Lennis

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Layter, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son  mayores de edad, el menor tiene 2 años, con ella también vive una nieta de 7 años la misma que  estudian en escuela, sus hijos mayores ya son independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja casi todos los días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho  días, ella aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar para realizar los cobros y nuevas ventas ya en esos momentos tienen dinero para comprar sus productos. Nos comenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y los cosméticos. Lleva diez años dedicada a esta actividad y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos le permite ganarse la vida honradamente.
 
Sus sueños son arreglar su casa ya que aún le falta.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar Communal Bank gets together every two weeks at the beautiful San Mateo resort in the city of Manta, a place well-known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by both national and international tourists. The majority of Manta's inhabitants work in the fishing industry or other sea-related duties.

This is where we met Ms. Layter, a 49-year-old woman who is married and has four children, three of whom are adults. The youngest is 2 years old. Her 7-year-old granddaughter also lives with them, and she attends school. Her eldest children are all independent. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a homemaker who sells Yanbal products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, fragrances, and accessories for women) door-to-door almost every day of the week in order to earn her own wages. She sells her products on credit, then collects every week. She takes advantage of the time when the fisherman return from the high seas so that she can collect and/or sell her products because this is when they have the money to buy things. She states that the products that she sells the most are fragrances and cosmetics. She has been selling products for 10 years, and she got her start with the first loan that she obtained from the institute.

This loan will be used to purchase fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, and other beauty products. She has been with the communal bank for 10 years, and she likes it because the loans help her make an honest living.

She dreams of making home repairs because they are needed.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Tsotso

texts.fr: Madame Tsotso est une femme de 33ans. Elle a 03enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Le premier a 07ans et le dernier 02ans. Elle est mariée à un maçon carreleur. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants, Tsotso s’est lancée dans la vente des bassines et cuvettes depuis 2006. Elle vend ses produits à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente. Elle a sollicité ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des bassines. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et prendre en charge la famille.
texts.en:
Tsotso is a 33-year-old woman.  She has three children whose ages range between 7 and 2 years.  Two of her children attend school.  She is married to a mason/tile fixer.  

In order to help her husband with household expenses, and also to provide a better future for her children, Tsotso has been selling tubs and plastic containers since 2006.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and sells from home.  Her main difficulty is a slump in sales.  

Tsotso has requested this first loan from WAGES for the purchase of tubs.  She wants to reinvest in the activity and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy tubs and plastic containers.

loans.name: Mt Usambala Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her mid forties, is married and has three children. Two of them go to school and one is grown up.  She has been running two small businesses, selling sarongs and local chicken for six years now.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. (just for 4 hours only) and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan for buying more sarongs and local chicken. Her dream is to one day be able to become an international businesswoman.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Usambara", which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sarongs and local chicken.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 41 years old, married, and has five children. He runs a grocery store to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition.To earn extra income, he has a bicycle transport business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy mangoes, oranges, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mahmudboi

texts.ru: Махмудбой более 20 занимается  аграрным бизнесом. Он женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Он любит работать на земле и выращивает сельхозпродукты. Также занимается купле- продажей скота. Отходы от выращивания культур идут на корм скота. Махмудбой запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота. Махмудбой надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mahmudboi has been involved in an agricultural business for over 20 years.  He is married and has one child.  His wife is involved in household work.  Mahmudboi loves to work on the land and grow agricultural crops.  He is also involved in buying and selling livestock.  The leftovers from growing crops go toward feeding livestock.  Mahmudboi is requesting this loan to buy cattle.  He relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Umsunai

texts.ru:
Умсунай 50 лет, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1992 году Умсунай начала свой бизнес в садоводстве и животноводстве.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Также, в связи с тем, что Умсунай по образованию швея, она занимается пошивом национальных изделий, что приносит небольшой доход в корзину семьи. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Умсунай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян. Доходы Умсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Umsunai is 50 years old, married and raised two children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she started her own business in gardening and animal husbandry in 1992.  The business, started with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), today yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  Also, due to the fact that Umsunai is a seamstress, she is involved in sewing national goods, which brings in a small income for the family's basket.  In order to further develop her business, Umsunai requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy fertilizers and seeds.  Umsunai plans to invest the earning into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Adono

texts.fr:
Adono est une femme âgé(e) de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un transitaire et a 04 enfants dont deux scolarisés. L’ainé a 24ans et le dernier 10ans.
Adono travaille comme revendeuse de légumes et condiments depuis 1990. Elle vend à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Adono a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des légumes et condiments. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et arriver à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Adono is a 43-year-old woman who is married to a forwarding agent and has four children.  Two of her children attend school.  Her oldest child is 24 years old, the youngest is 10.  

Adono has been reselling vegetables and condiments since 1990.  She buys her goods in Lomé and sells from home.

Adono has requested her second loan from WAGES for the purchase of vegetables and condiments.  She wants to reinvest in the activity and to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Assiatta

texts.fr: Revendeuse de chaussures et divers à la maison depuis 2000, Assiatta est une femme de 59ans. Elle a 02 enfants âgés de 30 et 25ans. Elle est reconnue par une majorité de personnes qui viennent acheter chez elle. Afin de répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter des chaussures et autres. Elle voudrait avec les profits supplémentaires réinvestir dans l’activité, et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
A retailer of shoes and more, Assiatta is a 59-year-old woman who has been selling out of her house since 2000. She has two children, aged 25 and 30. She is familiar to most of the people coming to buy at her home. 

To meet the needs of her customers, Assiatta is requesting this second loan to buy some shoes and other goods. She would like to use the extra profits to reinvest in her business and to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy shoes and more

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural del municipio de Intibucá, La Esperanza.

Pedro y su esposa se ayudan mutuamente y tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente la siembra del cultivo de papa. EL vende la papa en producto fresco en el mercado local. Siendo muy  pequeño aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que esa ha sido la tradición familiar.  Siembra 2 tareas de papa 3 ciclos por año. Este negocio le ha generado buenas ganancias por el cual esta muy contento y por eso dedica 9 horas diarias trabajando en sus cultivos.

El préstamo que ha solicitado de 10,000 lempiras considera que es una oportunidad para mejorar su producción dándole el mantenimiento requerido por lo tanto la inversión que hará es comprar fertilizante y pesticida para el control de plaga para su cultivo. Mejorando obtener una mejor cosecha y seguir vendiendo.
Su intención es seguirle dando el mantenimiento necesario para seguir generando el capital que le ayude a sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 30 years old, married, and has a two-year-old son.  He lives in a rural neighborhood in the town of Intibucá, La Esperanza.

Pedro and his wife help one another.  They have 10 years of experience in the agriculture business and specialize in the cultivation of potatoes.  He sells fresh potatoes at the local market.  At a young age, Pedro learned to work the land and has continued the family tradition.  He plants two crops of potatoes within a three-cycle period each year.  This business has generated a good income, so he is very pleased.  Pedro works nine hours each day tending to his crops.

The loan he is requesting in the amount of 10,000 HNL represents an opportunity to improve his production.  Maintaining his crops requires an investment in the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to control diseases to his crop.  These improvements will result in a better harvest and enable him to continue selling.  His intention is to provide the maintenance required to generate capital to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rufina Llano Grande Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  "Rufina Llano grande" esta integrado por seis mujeres trabajadoras y humildes  originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado llano grande.
En llano grande hay árboles frescos y canchas de fulbot y básquet para que los jóvenes y niños vayan a jugar en familia.
Una de las integrantes de este  grupo es la señora  Rufina de cuarenta y un  años de edad   se dedica a la matanza de res  desde hace veinte años, ella nos dice que lo mas le gusta de su negocio  es limpiar la carne de res y tasajearla  y darle una buena  atención a sus clientes.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Lorenzo de  cincuenta años de edad  con quien tiene una hija  Mareli  de cuatro años de edad  quien quiere  mucho y es  su inspiración.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  más materiales para la matanza de res  como es: cuchichoos maquina para  moler la carne.
Ella nos cuenta  que  gracias a fundacion a podido engrandecer su negocio y a que antes solamente vendía  carne de  marrano pero gracias al apoyo de fundacion ya vende lo que es  carne de res y de marrano y elabora barbacoa de res para la venta.
Esta muy agradecida con fundacion por apoyarla a ella y a sus compañeras para que su negocio crezca y mejoren sus vidas.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Yolanda- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Fortina Clara – se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Judith- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Francisca Lucia - se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Deyci- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por apoyar  a  la gente  indígena y trabajadora de pueblos marginados.
texts.en:
This group called “Rufina Llano Grande” is made up of 6 humble, hard-working women who originate from a little town called Llano Grande.

In Llano Grande there are trees, soccer fields and basketball courts so children and youngsters can go out and play with their families. 

One of the members of this group is Rufina, 41, and she has been a butcher for 20 years. She tells us that what she likes most about her job is cleaning the meat, cutting it and giving her clients some good customer service.

She’s happily married to Lorenzo, 50, and they have a daughter, Mareli, who is 4 years old and is her love and inspiration.

She’s requesting this loan to buy more tools for butchering meat, like knives and a meat grinding machine.  
She tells us that thanks to the foundation she has been able to expand her business; she used to sell only pork, but with the help from the foundation, she’s able to sell beef and pork, and she prepares barbecued beef for sale, too. 

She’s very grateful to the foundation for supporting her and the other members so that their businesses can grow and they can improve their lives.

The other members of the group are the following:
Yolanda sells Mexican snacks.
Fortina Clara sells perfume.
Judith runs a grocery store.
Francisca Lucia sells clothing.
Deyci sells fruits and vegetables.

They give their thanks to the foundation for supporting indigenous peoples and workers from marginalized towns.

loans.use: buy tools for butchering meat.

location.town: santiago llano grande la banda oaxaca

loans.name: Lisbeth Andreina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar  que se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a Lisbeth, tiene 23 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando el último año de colegio, nos cuenta que empezó tarde sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos pero ahora con lo que gana en su negocio espera terminar una carrera universitaria. Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal varios  ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda y confianza que le dan.

Ella para salir adelante y con esto poder continuar con sus estudios hace varios años puso un bar en su casa en el cual vende jugos, gaseosas y todo tipo de bebidas, además hace poco y con ayuda del crédito que recibió también empezó con la venta de bisutería, ventas que realiza en su local o puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días aunque que los días  que más vende son los fines de semana ya que estos días son cuando llegan más turistas hasta el lugar a disfrutar de las hermosas playas, ella lleva 5 años con su negocio y gracias a esto empezó a estudiar.

Este crédito es para comprar bisutería, sodas, aguas, colas entre otras cosas.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una profesional.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar comunal bank meets every two weeks at the beautiful  beach community of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited year round by native and foreign tourists. The majority of the residents here work in fishing and maritime jobs.

This is where we meet Lisbeth, age 23.  She is currently in her last year of school.  She tells us that she stared her studies late due to a lack of financial resources.  But, now, with what she earns in her business, she hopes to finish her college education.  She lives in her parents’ house.  She has been in the communal bank for several cycles, and she likes it because of the help and the confidence it gives her.

In order to get ahead and be able to continue her studies, she set up a  juice bar in her house several years ago.  She sells juices, soft drinks, and all types of drinks.  Also, a little while ago, with help from the loan she received, she also started to sell jewelry.  She sells the jewelry at her place or door to door.  She works every day.  She sells the most on the week-ends because this is when more tourists come to the area to enjoy the beautiful beaches.  

She has had her business for five years.  Thanks to this she started her studies.

This loan is to buy jewelry, sodas, and water, among other things.

Her dreams are to finish her studies and to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, sodas, and water, among other things.

loans.name: Erika Liliana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Erika, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de 5 años de edad la misma que  este año empieza a estudiar en un jardín de infantes de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella  tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, a pesar de que no tiene mucho tiempo su negocio tiene de todo ya que son muchos sus clientes y cada día le piden mayor variedad de productos, ella tiene además de víveres artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que hay días en que llegan los pescadores y se reúnen en su local a compartir entre amigos alguna bebida,  lleva en este negocio por más de 2 años y le va muy bien y ahora mejor con la ayuda de los créditos.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres en general y útiles escolares. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le  da el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda del lugar.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar Communal Bank gets together every two weeks at the beautiful San Mateo resort in the city of Manta, a place well-known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by both national and international tourists. The majority of Manta's inhabitants work in the fishing industry or other sea-related duties.

This is where we met Ms. Erika, a 21-year-old married mother of a 5-year-old girl who is starting preschool this year. Erika's husband is a fisherman.

She runs a small store from home in which she sells foodstuffs. Despite the fact that Erika does not have much time, her business has a wide variety of products because many of her customers ask her for several products each day. Besides provisions, she sells housewares and school supplies. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. She sometimes works even later because there are days when the fisherman get together at her store to share a few drinks. She has been in business for over 2 years, and she has been prosperous, even more so with the help of these loans.

Erika will use this loan to restock her shop, purchasing provisions and school supplies. She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles, and she likes it because of the help she receives.

Her dream is to own the best store in the area.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and school supplies.

loans.name: La Carrera Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo tiene el nombre de “La Carrera”, ellos pertenecen a la comunidad de Dotegiare ubicada en el municipio de San Felipe del Progreso, las integrantes de este grupo decidieron aponerle este nombre ya que para ellas representa una carrera con la vida, ellas creen que la vida es como una carrera que siempre hay que ganar y es la base de su esfuerzo constante, ésta se caracteriza por ser  una comunidad mazahua con personas muy trabajadoras y de conocimientos de artesanías mazahuas,  orgullosos de sus raíces, aunque es una comunidad pequeña las  personas son muy unidas, es una comunidad pequeña y prácticamente todos los habitantes se conocen unos a otros, lo conforman 12 mujeres muy humildes y trabajadoras, las cuales decidieron unirse a este grupo para poder emprender una actividad productiva.
Los nombres de las integrantes y sus respectivas actividades son las siguientes:
1.- María Ángela B. (compra de refrescos y dulces para vender)
2.- María Bonifacia G. (compra de servilletas, manteles, hilos, para costura y venta)
3.- Victoria S. (compra de frutas y verduras para vender)
4.- Alejandra M. (compra de 5 borregos para vender)
5.- María S. (compra de 2 borregos para vender)
6.- María del Carmen S. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
7.- Ma. Elena T. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
8.- Virginia M. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
9.- Catalina R. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
10.- Rosaura L. (compra de 4 borregos para cría y venta)
11.- Celia C. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
12.- Juana M. (compra de dulces para vender)
Doña Victoria es una mujer de 39 años de edad que estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, la cual se dedica al trabajo en el hogar, ella es la representante de este grupo y está casada desde hace 15 años con el señor Doroteo, juntos tuvieron a 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 9 años, los cuales actualmente estudian. La señora Victoria es clienta de FRAC y es muy responsable y optimista, ella solicita este crédito porque se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, en esta ocasión ella comprará: jitomate, tomate, chiles, cebollas, papas, nopales, plátanos y mangos.  Ella compra su fruta cada 8 días en un municipio llamado Atlacomulco, y se la lleva a su casa donde la vende, o sale a ofrecerla casa por casa, a ella se le ocurrió emprender este negocio para apoyarse en los gastos de la escuela y sustento de sus hijos, ya que por ahora no se encuentra con ella su esposo, en este negocio lleva ya 2 años de experiencia, en los que comenta le ha ido muy bien y el único problema que ha tenido para desarrollar su actividad es una enfermedad que le dio en sus pies y hace que se canse mucho cuando va caminando para ofrecer sus frutas y verduras, dice que el préstamo si le ayuda mucho ya que invierte y saca una ganancia que le ayuda bastante con sus gastos, a la señora Victoria le gustaría en un futuro comprarse un medio de transporte que le facilite el transporte de sus productos y no le cause molestias en sus pies.
texts.en:
The following group is called "La Carrera." The members belong to the community of Dotegiare, which is located in the municipality of San Felipe del Progreso. The members of this group decided to give their group this name since to them it represents a race with life. They believe that life is like a race which always has to be won, and this is the base of their constant effort. This is a characteristic Mazahua community with very hard-working people with knowledge of Mazahua handcrafts and pride in their roots. Even though it is a small community, the people are very hardworking. This group decided to unite to be able to undertake productive activities.

The names of the members and their respective business activities are the following:
1.- María Ángela B. (buy soft drinks and sweets to sell)
2.- María Bonifacia G. (buy napkins, tablecloths, and thread, to embroider and sell)
3.- Victoria S. (buy fruits and vegetables to sell)
4.- Alejandra M. (buy five sheep to sell)
5.- María S. (buy two sheep to sell)
6.- María del Carmen S. (buy groceries to sell)
7.- Ma. Elena T. (buy groceries to sell
8.- Virginia M. (buy groceries to sell)
9.- Catalina R. (buy groceries to sell
10.- Rosaura L. (buy four sheep to raise and sell)
11.- Celia C. (buy groceries to sell)
12.- Juana M. (buy sweets to sell)

Doña Victoria is a 39-year-old woman who went to school through the sixth year of primary school and works in her home. She is the representative of this group and was married 15 years ago to Señor Doroteo. Together they have 3 children, ages 15, 11, and 9, who are now in school. Señora Victoria is a client of FRAC and is very responsible and optimistic. She is applying for this loan because her work is selling fruits and vegetables. On this occasion she will buy red tomatoes, green tomatoes, chiles, onions, potatoes, nopal (cactus), bananas, and mangoes. She buys her fruit every 8 days in a town called Atlacomulco, and she takes it to her house where she sells it, or she goes out to offer it door to door. She had the idea to begin this business to help with the school expenses and support of her children, since for the moment her husband is not with her. She has two years of experience in this business, and she comments that it has gone very well for her, and the only problem that she has had in developing her business is an illness in her feet that makes her very tired when she walks around to offer her fruits and vegetables. She says that the loan will help her a lot since she will invest it and get earnings that will help her quite a bit with her expenses. In the future Señora Victoria would like to buy a means of transportation which will make transport of her products easier and won't cause soreness in her feet.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Artilleria Group

texts.es: Omar tiene 31 años de edad y está casado con Mónica la cual es ama de casa, ellos no tienen hijos, comenta Omar “todavía queremos esperar un poco más para tener hijos ya que quiero tener algo más estable  como mi negocio y tener una casa propia para así darles una mejor calidad de vida”. El tiene un café internet desde hace 8 años y dice que lo puso por que le llamaba la atención las computadoras y entro a estudiar en una escuela de computo donde aprendió lo básico, y aunque no termino la carrera el decidió emprender el negocio y aprendió porque  un amigo le enseño a cómo usar y manejar el internet. El está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de papel, tóner, discos, memorias, folders, lapiceros, para la reparación de equipos de cómputo y para la compra de una nueva impresora. Dice que su material lo compra en la ciudad de México ya que allá le dan un poco más barato los artículos, Dice que una de sus problemática es que tiene que pagar renta del local donde tiene su negocio y el espera más adelante hacer su propio local para ya no gastar en rentas. Sus otros nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman Maritere, María Guadalupe, dos señoras que se llaman María Elena, Ana Laura, Porfiria, Hugo, Inés y Susana ellos invertirán en sus negocios como en la compra de zapatos por catalogo para su venta, en ropa de segunda para su venta, en bisutería, insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos, ropa interior para venta, diferentes dulces para su venta y zapatos para su venta.
texts.en:
Omar, 31, is married to Mónica who is a housewife; they do not have children.  Omar comments: “We still want to wait a little longer to have children because I want to have something more stable like my business and have a house of my own in order to give them a better quality of life.” 

He has had an Internet café for 8 years and he says that he set it up because computers interested him so he enrolled in a computer school where he learned the basics and even though he did not finish the career he decided to start the business and learned because a friend taught him how to use and operate the Internet.

He is asking for the loan to buy paper, toner, discs, memories, folders and mechanical pencils to repair his computer equipment and to buy a new printer.  He says that he buys his supplies in Mexico City since prices are a little lower there.  He says that one of his problems is that he has to pay rent for the locale his business is in and he hopes later on to build a space of his own in order to save on rental cost.

The other nine group members are: Maritere, María Guadalupe, María Elena, María Elena, Ana Laura, Porfiria, Hugo, Inés and Susana.  They will invest in their various businesses like: shoes by catalogue to sell, second-hand clothes to sell, costume jewelry, ingredients to make Mexican fast food snacks, underwear to sell, assorted candy to sell and in shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy paper, toner, pencils and to repair computer equipment and to buy a new printer.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a 63-year old divorced mother of two, has been operating a kiosk for the past six years. She is requesting a loan of Ksh. 30,000 to add a stock of rice to her retail shop. Local residents are her primary customers, and she aspires to open a wholesale enterprise in the future.

Mariam’s major challenge is stiff market competition, and food is her greatest monthly expense. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to add a stock of rice to her retail shop.

loans.name: Adakouvi

texts.fr: Adakouvi est une femme de 37ans. Elle est mariée à un comptable et a des jumeaux âgés de 06ans qui fréquentent.  Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005, adakouvi vend dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle a démarré en 2005.
texts.en: Adakouvi  is a 37-old year woman. Her husband is an accountant. They have six-year old twins who are in school. Adakouvi has been selling groceries since 2005. She sells out of a store ans tocks up in Lome. She is seeking this first loan in order to buy groceries. She would like to reinvest in her business, expand it and improve the living conditions of her family. She launched this business in 2005.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Noyolot Group

texts.es: Los nuevos integrantes del grupo son la señora Miriam va a comprar con su préstamo abono e insecticida, el señor Valentín va a comprar fruta pera, ciruela, nuez, el señora Mario va a comprar Jabón, aceite, azúcar, sabritas, galletas, refrescos, el resto de los integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Flor tiene 38 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es carpintero, ellos tiene 2 hijos varones mayores de edad ya trabajan, ella tiene una carpintería, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar mader y una maquina caladora para su taller, ella elabora muebles de madera, camas, mesas, sillas, comedor, puertas, ventanas, etc. lo que pida el cliente, ella inicio su negocio hace 28 años es herencia de su papa él le enseño a su esposo a elaborar muebles de madera, su negocio es importante porque obtiene ingresos para mantenernos, ella se siente orgullosa de seguir con el negocio de su papa, de ser su propio patrón, su negocio es popular por trabajar con pura madera de buena calidad. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que crezca su carpintería comprar unas maquinas grandes para tener completo el taller y que su hijos aprendan este oficio  la carpintería. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamo, son muy amables al ayudarnos a crecer los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
The new group members are Miriam who will use her loan to buy manure and insecticide; Valentín who is going to buy pears, plums and walnuts and Mario who will buy soap, oil, sugar, Sabritas brand snacks, cookies and soft-drinks.  The rest of the group members continue with the activities they’ve been carrying on.

Flor, 38, is married; her husband is a carpenter.  They have two older sons who already work.  She has a carpentry shop and asked for her loan to buy lumber and a hand-held power saw for her shop.  

She manufactures wood furniture, beds, tables, dining sets, doors, windows, etc. – whatever the customer requests.  She started the business 28 years ago.  It was passed down from her father who taught her husband to make wood furniture.  The business is important because she earns income to support themselves.  She feels proud to be continuing her father’s business and being her own boss.  Her business is popular because she works only with good quality wood.  Her dreams and hopes is that the carpentry shop grows, to buy some large pieces of machinery to complete the shop and that her children learn carpentry.

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Many thanks for your loans.  You are very kind to help our business and our families to grow.”

loans.use: to buy lumber and an electric drill.

loans.name: El Huamuchi Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el Huamuchi esta conformado por diez mujeres  indígenas trabajadoras.
Una de las integrantes   es la señora Carmen una señora trabajadora y humilde  de cincuenta y ocho años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace un año.
Doña Carmen  Cleofas nos cuenta que tiene dos trabajadores quienes se dedican a elaborar el pan y ella solamente  se dedica a comprarle los ingredientes ya que esta enferma y le hace daño acercarse al calor del horno, pero se siente  orgullosa de sus trabajadores ya que  tienen los pedidos a tiempo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes.
Doña Carmen Cleofas esta felizmente casada  con el señor  Pablo de  53 años de edad dice que  esta feliz ya que esposo la trata bien a pesar de que esta mas joven que ella.
Doña Carmen como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo   nos  dice que los panes que ella hace se llaman : panquesitos, rosquitas, gringos, muelas, gusano, donas, petatitos, enpanochadas, papayo  y costra y el mas que mas vende son los petatitos.
Doña Carmen esta feliz con su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y además a  sus clientes  le gusta mucho su pan.
Tiene  la cantidad de  tres hijos Pedro  Paulo, José Ángel  y Emili quienes le ayudan  Para que su negocio crezca y ella este feliz y pueda tener mas ingresos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboración de pan como es: levadura, royal, azucar, harina, margarina, huevo y manteca.
Doña Carmen nos cuenta que esta muy contenta por el apoyo que le ha dado fundación ella y a sus compañeras  para que sus vidas camben.
Las otras integrantes  del grupo son:
Maria Magdalena- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Obdulia- se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Blanca Luz – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ines- se  dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Maria Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Elvira- se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Maria del Carmen- se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
Diana del  Rocio – se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Cleotilde- se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las mujeres y sobre todo a las madres solteras.
texts.en:
This group called Huamuchi is made up of ten humble and hard-working indigenous women originating from Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca, where the people are hard-working.  One of the members is Carmen, a humble and hardworking woman who is 58 years old and who has made a living selling bread for a year.  

Carmen Cleofás tells us that she has two employees who make the bread and she just buys the ingredients, since she is ill and gets injured when she gets close to the heat of the oven.  But she is proud of her employees because they complete the orders on time and avoid disappointing her customers.

Carmen Cleofás is happily married to Pablo, who is 53 years old.  She says she is happy that her husband treats her well in spite of the fact that he is younger than she is.  Dona Carmen, as she is better known to her friends/fellow group members, tells us that she names her bread the following:
"panquesitos", "rosquitas", "gringos", "muelas", "gusano", "donas", "petatitos", "enpanochadas", "papayo" and "costra", and her best-selling bread is "petatitos".  Carmen is happy with her business as it allows for a good income and also her customers really like her bread.

She has three children: Pedro Paulo, José Ángel y Emili, who help increase her business and she is happy with the extra income.
She asked for the loan to buy more ingredients for making bread, such as:  yeast, Royal brand baking powder, sugar, flour, margarine, eggs and butter.

Carmen tells us that she is very happy with the support that the foundation has given her and her fellow members so that they can change their lives.  The other members of the group are:
María Magdalena – sells clothing
Obdulia – sells livestock
Blanca– sells Mexican snacks
Inés – sells Mexican snacks
María Guadalupe – sells food
Elvira – sells fish
María del Carmen – sells tortillas
Diana del  Roció – sells clothing
Clotilde – sells clothing

They give thanks to the foundation for helping all of the women, and above all the single mothers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
This is Diosdado, a 35-year-old single man residing in Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. At this time, he is working hard to continually earn income for his everyday expenses.

Diosdado operates a biscuit-retailing business, buying biscuit products, including cookies, from wholesalers and then selling them per piece/pack for a profit, earning a minimum of 2500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. Customers are attracted to his low selling prices and the many options he offers. Diosdado also sells meat for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.

To help him continue operations of his business, Diosdado is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Diosdado faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in his business

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina Isabel inicia sus actividades a las 5 de la mañana haciendo compras de las riquísimas Frutas de la Temporada para la elaboración de refrescos y venta de frutas, posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de trabajo ofreciéndole a pacientes y visitantes sus diferentes productos, terminando sus labores  a las 4 pm.

El crédito la señora Marina Isabel lo utilizará para la compra  de gaseosas, jugos variados, agua y Frutas de la Temporada, este crédito le ayudará a mejorar en su actividad, ofreciéndoles  a sus clientes variedad de bebidas, para tener mayores ventas y así lograr a tener más ganancia.

Ella  se siente muy agradecida con Ceprodel, ya que con los préstamos a incrementado su inventario y ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina Isabel starts her activities at 5 in the morning buying delicious seasonal fruit to make beverages and to sell.  She then goes to her stand to offer patients and visitors various products.  Her work day ends at 4pm.

Marina Isabel will use the loan to buy soft-drinks, assorted juices, water and seasonal fruit.  This loan will help her improve her activity offering her customers a variety of beverages in order to have greater sales and more profits.

She is very grateful to Ceprodel because with the loans she’s increased her inventory and made improvements to her dwelling.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, assorted juices, water, candy, cigarettes and chocolates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, necesita realizar la inversión en el negocio, por eso a través de un nuevo préstamo piensa comprarse cerdos para el destazo, algunos los mantendrá en la granja para engordarlos, este préstamo le ayudara para tener la oportunidad de seguir trabajando y proveyendo para su familia lo necesario.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a generar más ventas y ganancias para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Lucia needs to make an investment in her business. That is why she will use a new loan to purchase pigs for butchering, although she will keep some on the farm in order to fatten them up. This loan will help her have the opportunity to keep working and provide what her family needs.
The previous loan generated positive results, helping her increase her sales and income in order to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, three enrolled in school. She operates a green grocery and sells her goods from home.  She has been in the business for the last three years. Her ambition is to open a kiosk. Her other sources of income include earnings from her husband. She joined Yehu so as to get funds to expand her business. 

Mwanakombo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her major challenge to be price fluctuation and her greatest monthly expense to be food for the family. She intends to use the loan of Ksh 25,000 to purchase tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Canastitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los canastitos lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa quien vende frituras como platanitos, yuquitas, enchiladas y papas…etc. Este negocio en el que trabaja desde hace 40 años e invertirá el crédito en materia prima como plátanos, aceite, leña…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Maribel del Socorro quien Elabora Canasta s de bambú y Kenia quien vende pan como bonetes, picos, pan de molde…etc.
texts.en:
Los Canastitos Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women.  One of them is Rosa, who sells fried snacks such as plantains, yucca, enchiladas, potatoes, etc.  She started this business forty years ago, and she will invest the loan in basic supplies such as plantains, oil, firewood, etc.

The other members are Maribel del Socorro, who makes bamboo baskets, and Kenia, who sells bread such as "bonetes," "picos," sandwich bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as plantains, oil, and bags.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de comida. Este negocio lo inicio hace 33 años empezó trabajando en una comideria y luego puso su negocio. 
Ella es del grupo Magnolia y solicita este crédito autoestima para poder realizarse un chequeo médico y comprar la medicina.
texts.en: Señora María Elena is a hard-working and enterprising woman who sells food.  She started this business 33 years ago by working in a restaurant and later started her own business.  She is part of the communal bank, "Magnolia," and she is requesting this loan to be able to have a medical checkup and to buy medicine.

loans.use: to have a medical checkup.

loans.name: Yarha Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yarha está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa Argentina quien se dedica al comercio de cartera desde hace 25 años con lo cual saco adelante a sus 6 hijos los cuales todos son mayores.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en carteras.
Las otras integrantes son Karla Patricia quien desde hace 15 años tiene una pulpería y María Ligia quien tiene una comideria.
texts.en:
The group Yarha is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Rosa Argentina, who has made a living selling handbags for 25 years and by which she got her 6 older children ahead.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of handbag merchandise.

The other members of the group are Karla Patricia, who has had a small grocery store for fifteen years, and Ligia, who has an eatery.

loans.use: to purchase handbag merchandise.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rio de agua viva está conformado por tres mujeres trabadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Zoila quien es comerciante de bisutería y ropa desde hace 15 años. Este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño tramo en el mercado más populoso de Managua y ahora también tiene una tienda en su casa. 
Ella es soltera y tiene una niña de 11 años y su meta es terminar sus estudios universitarios actualmente está terminando su tesis.
Las otras integrantes son Eufemia de 53 años de edad y Yessenia de 30 años de edad quienes desde hace 15 años comercializan bisutería.
texts.en:
The group Rio de Agua Viva is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of them is Zoila who has been a storekeeper of costume jewelry and clothing for 15 years. She began this business with a small stretch in Managua's most populous market, and she now also has a store in her home.

She is single and has an 11-year-old daughter. Her goal is to complete her university studies and she is currently completing her thesis.

The other members of the group are 53-year-old Eufemnia and 30-year-old Yesica, both of whom have been selling costume jewelry for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió, siendo una ciudad privilegiada por su cultura y tradiciones, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil.

La Señora. Ana tiene 47 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de los cuales dos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja para sus gastos personales. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Ana se dedica a vender juguetes, su producto lo vende en diferentes escuelas, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 19 años, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando juguetes para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es de terminar su casa la cual se encuentra en construcción.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of El Crédito Communal Bank.  She lives in Cuenca, an exceptional city known for its culture and traditions as well as its cold climate.  In 1999, it was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  It has a diverse gastronomy that captivates locals and visitors alike.  The people are known for being friendly and helpful.  

Ana is 47 years old.  She is married and has three children from this union, two of which are married and living independently; her unmarried son works to pay his personal expenses.  Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services.  She doesn’t own her own home so she is renting.

Ana is in the business of selling toys and sells her products in various schools.  She has been in this business for nineteen years and works from Monday to Friday all day.  She has been a member of the communal banks for thirteen years and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of toys to continue her business.  Her goal is to complete her home which is under construction.

loans.use: to purchase toys.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva, 42, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Minerva operates a used car business. What she basically does is buy second-hand cars from sellers then she upgrades or repairs them and the sells them for a profit. Cars can range from older to more modern models. Customers are attracted to buy due to the fair selling prices she offered. Her regular customers are people who wanted to acquire a vehicle in their local community. She earns a minimum of Php 10,000 in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10, 000 loan.She will be utilizing the loan to do repairs and upgrades to the cars that she buys. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Minerva dreams to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for upgrades and repairs to vehicles that she acquires in her business.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de mèches et habits depuis 2004, Akouvi est  une femme âgée de 29ans. Elle a commencé son activité depuis 2004. Elle a loué une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Vu que la demande au niveau des clients est élevée, elle sollicite un troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter des tissages, bijoux et habits pour enfants. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en augmentant le stock, étendre l’activité en installant d’autres points de vente.
texts.en: Akouvi, age 29, has been reselling hair extensions and clothing since 2004.  She started her business in 2004.  She rents a shop and buys her goods in  Lomé.  Because of a high customer demand, she is requesting a third loan from WAGES for the purchase of braids, jewelry and children's clothing.  She wants to reinvest in the activity and increase her stock.  She also wants to expand her business and open other retail outlets.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, braids, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-years-old married woman with 4 children, all of whom are in school. She operates a poultry business and has been doing this business for the last 5 years.  

With the Ksh. 50,000, she plans to buy chicks and chicken feed. She sells her products both from home and at the market, to friends and neighbors. High transportation cost is her major challenge. Her aim is to become the leading supplier of broilers in the area. Mary owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is family food.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en:
Mumbua is a 59-years-old a business lady. She is married to Boniface. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family members.

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Mumbua will use the loan to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate the last born child since the others are adults. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Kayissan

texts.fr: Kayissan est une femme âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 18ans et le dernier 10ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et vend en même temps des sacs et des produits divers (lait, sucre, détergents). Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs dames et des produits divers.  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en l’agrandissant et mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Son activité a été démarrée en 2002.
texts.en: Kayissan, age 40, is married to a teacher and has three children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 10.  By training a hairdresser, Kayissan also sells handbags and other various items (milk, sugar, detergent).  This is the first time she is requesting a loan for the purchase of women's handbags and other retail items.  She wants to reinvest into expanding her business.  She also wants to take better care of her family.  Kayissan started her business in 2002.

loans.use: to buy handbags and various other retail items.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió, siendo una ciudad privilegiada por su cultura y tradiciones, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil.

Doña Rosa tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en un taxi que es de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa tiene una tienda de comestibles desde hace 10 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también vende pollos pelados hace 2 años.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 8 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando víveres para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es de seguir creciendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “El Crédito” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place with a cold climate.  It’s a city that’s privileged because of its culture and traditions.  Since December, 1999 it’s been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its cuisine is varied and enchants both locals and foreigners alike.  Its people are noted for being kind and pleasant.

Rosa is 55 years old, married and has had five children who are all adults, married and living on their own.  Her husband is a driver and provides taxi services in a taxi he owns.  The house they live in is their property.

Rosa has had a grocery store for the last 10 years.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She’s also been selling dressed chickens for the last two years.  She’s been in the3 communal bank for 8 years and will use her new loan to buy foodstuffs for her store.  Her goal is to continue growing in her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Rayo de Luz (Ray of Light) 2. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. The group members are dedicated to selling cloth, food, shoes and many other miscellaneous products. 

Ana has had her business for approximately 5 years, starting with some savings she had. She plans to use this loan to invest in her cafeteria, where she sells natural juices, soda and some snacks. With this loan, she will invest in her business by increasing her inventory.

She lives in a simple structure with her four children and her husband. She says her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business and introduce other products and services. One of her favorite things to do is work. Carmen is excited about her 4th loan with Esperanza. She will use the profits to improve her business and to buy some enamelware to introduce sandwiches and others products. Ana thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy snacks, fruit, soda, cookies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elsa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Elsa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió, siendo una ciudad privilegiada por su cultura y tradiciones, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil.

La Señora. Elsa tiene 25 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija  de un año y cuatro meses. Su esposo es un profesional en la gasfitería, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Elsa es comerciante ambulante de juguetes, actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 10 años, también vende bisutería y artículos de papelería, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su madre. Su crédito lo va a invertir comprando bisutería, juguetes y artículos de papelería  para su negocio.
 
Su meta es de acabar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of El Crédito Communal Bank.  She lives in Cuenca, an exceptional city known for its culture and traditions as well as its cold climate.  In 1999, it was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  It has a diverse gastronomy that captivates locals and visitors alike.  The people are known for being friendly and helpful.  

Elsa is 25 years old.  She is married and has a sixteen month old daughter from this union.  Her husband is a plumber by profession and they own the house in which they live.  

Elsa works a as a street vendor selling toys, and has been engaged in this activity for ten years.  She also sells costume jewelry and stationery products.  She works form Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.  

Her mother invited her to join the communal bank and this is her first loan.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of costume jewelry, toys, and stationery products for her business.  Her goal is to finish working on her home as there are still further projects to be done.

loans.use: to purchase costume jewelry, toys, and stationery products.

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es: La señora Rosa  es  una persona trabajadora y honesta, ella es cliente distinguida de la  institución ya que  a lo largo de  sus créditos  se  ha  caracterizado  por  tener  una excelente  cultura  de  pago,  nos  comenta  que esta  muy contenta  de habernos encontrado ya que  en diversas  ocasiones   la hemos  apoyado para  la realización de sus  proyectos, en este  momento  ella  requiere  pintar   las  paredes  exteriores  de  su vivienda, ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  que su  casa  tenga  una mejor imagen.
texts.en: Rosa is a hard-working and honest person. She is a distinguished client of the institution, since with all her loans, she has demonstrated an outstanding payment record. She reports that she is very happy to have found us [Credituyo], since on diverse occasions we have helped her to carry out her plans. At this time, she needs to paint the exterior walls of her home. She sees the loan as giving her the opportunity to give her house a better image.

loans.use: to paint the exterior walls of her home.

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr: Madame Oulimata vit dans l’une des localités  sénégalaises.  Elle est âgée  de 57 ans et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de  détergents ou savon en poudre. Elle a choisi cette activité pour lutter contre l’oisiveté. Son objectif est de participer au développement de sa petite famille. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 17 et 27 ans.  Ce qui lui fait plaisir dans son activité c’est le bon produit et la satisfaction de sa clientèle. Elle est membre du guichet de sa zone d’habitation depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour  augmenter son fond de  roulement et  s’approvisionner  en sacs de savons en poudre. Son objectif est d’acheter a un cout plus compétitif afin de maximiser sa marge bénéficiaire .L’augmentation de ses gains lui permettra de contribuer a l’amélioration  des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oulimata, age 57, lives in a locality of Senegal.  She has been actively involved in retail business for more than 5 years and specializes in the sale of detergents and powder soap.  She chose this activity to fight idleness.  Her goal is to help her small family prosper.  She is married and has four children, whose ages range between 17 and 27 years.   She particularly enjoys her activity because of the quality of the product and because it brings satisfaction to her customers.  

Oulimata has been a member of her local lending institution since November 2003 and has already repaid a previous loan.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her working capital and to purchase some bags of powder soap.  Her goal is to buy at a more competitive price in order to maximize her profit margin.  With increased earnings, she will be able to participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy powder soap for resale.

loans.name: Edgar David

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar David es profesor de educación física en un colegio de Tarija, y aprovecha su oficio para poder comercializar sus productos deportivos a los estudiantes, el cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de productos deportivos como pelotas, zapatos, ropa deportiva, y otros. 

Edgar se encuentra separado pero tiene un hijo quien depende de sus ingresos, el menor estudia aun en colegio, y Edgar trata de darle una buena educación y condición de vida por ello siempre esta buscando la manera de generar mas recursos pues el sueldo de profesor es muy bajo, y aprovechando que se los estudiantes a quien el enseña necesitan material deportivo el les vende y les permite que les cancelen en cuotas, por tal motivo el solicita el credito para poder abastecerse de mas material deportivo.
texts.en:
Edgar David is a physical education teacher at a school in Tarija and takes advantage of his profession to sell sports equipment to students.  He has a small business selling sports products like balls, shoes, sportswear and others.

Edgar is separated and has a son who depends on his income; the youngster is still attending school and Edgar tries to give him a good education and living conditions which is why he’s always looking for ways of generating additional resources because his teacher’s pay is very low.  

Taking advantage of the fact that the students he teaches need sports equipment, he sells it to them and lets them pay him in installments so he’s asking for a loan to stock up on more sports equipment.

loans.use: to buy sports equipment.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, trabaja como parvularia (profesión donde aprenden a  cuidar niños) en una guardería privada y también  cuenta con el dinero que su esposo le envía ya que el trabaja como minero en  la zona de Los Yungas de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material escolar para sus hijos , pues las clases en los colegios ya han comenzado.
Virginia, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa alquilada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Virginia works as a "parvularia" [nursery school teacher] (a profession where they learn to care for children) in a private nursery school and she also relies on money her husband sends her since he works as a miner in the Los Yungas de la Paz zone.

She needs the loan to buy school supplies for her children because school classes have already begun.

Virginia is married and has two children she lives with in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  This is the third time she’s worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina es una persona que se  preocupa por  acondicionar  su  vivienda,  ya  que  considera  que  esta  es  el patrimonio de  sus   hijos,  en esta  ocasión se  acerca  a la  institución  ya  que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de  una  puerta  para  su  casa , agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de  su proyecto  ya que  ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  que  su  hogar  se  encuentre   protegido.
texts.en: Carolina is a person who cares about her home's condition, since she considers this to be her legacy for her children. At this time, she is turning to Kiva partner Credituyo because she wishes to purchase a door for her home. She is grateful for the support to carry out this project because she sees in the loan the possibility to make her home more secure.

loans.use: to purchase a door for her home.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, se dedica  a la venta de muñecos de peluche ya que cuenta con un puesto de venta en la ciudad de El Alto y también tiene ingresos de su esposo ya que el trabaja en una mina de los Yungas.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de  más muñecos de peluches para diversificar sus productos y de esta forma tener más ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Isabel, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Isabel sells stuffed toys; she has a stand in the city of El Alto and she also gets income from her husband who works in a mine in Los Yungas.

She needs the loan to buy more stuffed toys to diversify her products and earn more income to support her family.

Isabel is married and has four children she lives with in her own house in the city of La Paz’s Achachicala zone.  This is the first time she works with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more stuffed toys to sell.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
Rudy, trabaja como conductor asalariado dentro de un sindicato de transporte público en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento del vehiculo ya que no cuenta con más ingresos que los provenientes de su profesión de conductor para mantener a su familia.
Rudy, es soltero y tiene dos hijos, también esta a cargo de sus hermanos menores ya que son huérfanos de padres.  Viven en una casa en alquiler en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rudy works as a salaried driver in one of the city of La Paz’s transportation syndicates.  He needs the loan to service the vehicle because his only source of income to support his family is what he earns from his profession as a driver.

Rudy is single and has two children; he’s also caring for two younger siblings who are orphans.  They live in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle service and maintenance.

loans.name: Josue Daniel

texts.es: El joven Josue  es una  persona  que  día con día se  esfuerza  por salir  adelante, el  actualmente   tiene   una  estética   la  cual le   permite  obtener  ingresos,  el se acerco a la institución ya que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de materia  prima  para   su  negocio,  ya que  nos comenta  que  sus  clientes   han   ido  incrementando de manera  satisfactoria, agradece   el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su  proyecto ya que  le  permitira seguir  brindando a  sus clientes  el excelente servicio que  lo caracteriza.
texts.en: Josue is a young man who works hard to make headway from day to day. He currently has a beauty salon that allows him to make a living. He is turning to Kiva partner Credituyo because he wishes to purchase supplies for his business since he tells us his salon is attracting more customers at a satisfactory rate. He is grateful for the support in carrying out this project, which will allow him to keep providing his customers with the excellent service he is known for.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est âgée de 52 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle vend des tissus, des draps, des écharpes, des chaussures et des sacs. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion dans le but de se procurer une occupation. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité ce sont les gains. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 27 et  34 ans. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2011.Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour acheter des tissus et des chaussures à revendre. Elle veut augmenter son fond de roulement, accroitre ses bénéfices  ^pour participer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou is 52 years old and lives in Senegal.  She has been involved in retail business for more than five years.  She sells fabrics, sheets, scarves, shoes and handbags.  As she was looking for an occupation, she chose this activity because she really liked it.  She is particularly interested in the earnings generated by her activity.

Fatou is married and the mother of four children whose ages range between 27 and 34 years.  She has been a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC since December 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for the purchase of fabrics and shoes for resale.  She wants to increase her working capital and her profits in order to take part in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De Poaquil Group

texts.es: Leidy se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano ella necesita el capital para compra de materia prima para poder elaborar mas tejidos tipicos ya que por la epoca es cuando mas se vende es por eso que esta solicitando este credito, ellos son hermanos y quieren empezar  su propio negocio ya que ellos miran hoy en dia la vida es muy duro y cuesta encontrar un  trabajo para poder sostenerse, por eso necesitan este crédito para que sus sueños de tener su propio negocio se haga una realidad.
texts.en: Leidy makes a living hand-weaving traditional items. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies to be able to weave more items since this is the time where she sells the most products. She and Eswin are siblings and they want to start their own business because they see how hard life is from day to day and the difficulties in finding a job to sustain one's self. It's for this reason they need this loan, so their dreams of having their own business can become a reality.

loans.use: to purchase weaving supplies.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is a 51-year-old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in Dornogovi province in Southern Mongolia. He has been running an auto repair business for 7 years with his wife and children. When they moved to the center of the province, he started the business activity offering a few services inside his fence. Now the types of service have been extended and he has made many regular customers, not only in the area but from the neighboring provinces. He has just bought two broken-down cars at a lower price and is planning to buy some necessary spare parts to repair them. 

Ganbold is a talented man in his field and says, "I would like to repair these two cars by buying motors and some spare parts. I plan to sell them after repairing them." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy the motors and some spare parts for the cars.

loans.use: To buy motors and some spare parts for two cars

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
La cliente Maritza curso hasta la secundaria, durante ese tiempo sufrió bastante por la crisis económica que atravesó su padre, al perder toda la mercadería que transportaba. Específicamente se dedicaba a la comercialización de celulares y lentes que el traía, fue tan dura la vida para su familia entera por lo cual tuvieron que pasar hambre se encontraban totalmente en la ruina
Esta situasion motivo a Maritza a independizarse trabajando como ayudante en costura desde ese momento aprendió a costurar prendas de vestir para mujer nativa ya que su madre se dedicaba a la misma actividad, ahora ella se dedica a la confeccion y venta de estas prendas.
