loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
La Sr. Adelio tiene 41 años de edad, es macatero (Vendedor ambulante), está casado con el Sra. Julia de 43 años quien trabaja de empleada domestica. Ellos tienen tres hijos, todos son estudiantes.
 Don  Adelio empezó este negocio desde muy joven, tiene experiencia de 14 años. Se inicio en Asunción y Caacupé, hasta que decidió instalarse en Caaguazú hace algunos años y continúo por cuenta propia. Con las ganancias del negocio siempre pudo mantener su hogar y quitar adelante a su familia.
El Sr. Adelio solicita este crédito para la compra de ropas de  temporada invernal, y prepararse para la semana santa y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adelio is 41 years old, he is a street vendor, he's married to Julia who is 43 years old and works as a housekeeper. They have three children who are all studying.

Adelio started his business when he was very young; he has 14 years experience. He started out in Asunción and Caacupé, until he decided to set up in Caaguazú some years ago and he continued on his own. With the profits from his business he has always been able to maintain his house and get his family ahead. 

Adelio requests this loan to buy clothing for the winter season and to prepare for Easter, thus satisfying his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 31 años, vive en pareja con Ani,  en su casa la cual está terminando de a poco en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Desde sus 18 años trabaja como albañil, ya que no tenía tantas oportunidades para el estudio y vio que esta profesión le podía dar un buen futuro. Los vecinos le tienen gran admiración por el espíritu servicial que posee, rescatando su honestidad y emprendedurismo.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de algunas herramientas, ya que las que posee están viejas y desgastadas y no le ayuda mucho en su trabajo. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 31 years old. He lives with his partner Ani, in the house they are finishing little by little in the city of Carapeguá.

He has worked as a bricklayer since he was 18. As he didn't have many opportunities to study, he saw that this profession could give him a good future. His neighbours admire his helpful spirit, his honesty and entrepreneurship.

He requests a loan to buy some tools as the ones he has are old and worn out and don't help him much in his work.

He appreciates the help he is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 45 years old, single, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  She lives in Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  For the past 10 years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Cissy is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell.  The loan will help Cissy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to start a business of supplying cloth materials. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cissy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Adjoa est femme de 30ans. Elle est mariée à un chaudronnier et a 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 08ans et le dernier 02ans. Elle est revendeuse et jardinière. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter de l’engrais et des graines pour le jardinage.  Elle réinvestir dans son activité, acheter un autre terrain pour le jardinage et impliquer la famille dans l’activité. Elle a démarré en 2001.
texts.en: Adjoa is a 30-year old woman. She is married to a boilermaker and has two children, one of whom goes to school. Her children are 8 and 2 years old. She works as a retailer and gardener. Adjoa is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy fertilizer and seeds for gardening.  She plans to reinvest in her business, buy another piece of land to cultivate, and get her family involved in her activity. Adjoa started her business in 2001.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mayra Rosa

texts.es: Mayra Rosa es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito anterior todo lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de materiales para la producción del pan. La emprendedora nos expresa que con el apoyo que se le ha brindado ha aumentado la producción y sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar productos como harina, huevos, manteca, levadura, mantequilla, vainilla entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Mayra Rosa is an entrepreneur who has been working with the Fundación León 2000 on her last loan.  She invested all of it in her business by purchasing materials to make bread.  

This entrepreneur says that with the support she has been given her production has increased, and she has more customers. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy products like flour, eggs, lard, yeast, butter, and vanilla, among other products.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, lard, yeast, butter, and vanilla, among other products.

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.ru: Khanlar jenat, emu 52 goda, u nego chetvero detey vozrastov ot 20 do 27. Khanlar upravlayet svoim biznesom na protajenii 18 let. Osnovnaya sfera ego deyatelnosti eto pokupka I prodaja krupnogo rogatogo skota I moloka. Krome etogo on sobiraet moloko u mestnix jiteley I pereprodayet v molochnuyu firmu “Bilasuvar Agro”. Khanlar planiruet uvelichit kolichestvo jivotnix chtobi nachat rasshirit biznes I dla etogo emu nujni dengi v 1000 AZN. Na eti dengi on kupit baran.
texts.en: Khanlar is married. He is 52 years old, and has four children ranging between 20 and 27 years of age. Khanlar has been running his business for 18 years. His main business activity is buying and reselling cattle and milk. In addition, he collects milk from local and resells it to a dairy firm “Bilasuvar Agro.” Khanlar plans to  increase his livestock in order to expand his business. In order to do this, he needs 1,000 AZN. With this money, he plans to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep so as to expand the business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Joan has a pub. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked pub and also to build  her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero, es de la ciudad de Villarrica.
El es taxista, y con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar para su vehículo propio. Comenta que su puesto está ubicado en un punto estratégico, lo cual le ayuda a tener buena clientela y a la vez buenos ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia con el día a día.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una batería para su vehículo, y también para reparaciones en general. El esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le esta dando la fundación y Kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel is 42 years old. He is single and comes from the city of Villarrica.

He is a taxi driver and with a lot of effort he managed to buy his own vehicle. He comments that his post is located in a strategic spot, which helps him to have a good customer base as well as a high income. His goal is to continue growing and in this way be able to continue helping his family with their daily needs. 

He requests a loan to buy a battery for his vehicle and also to pay for general repairs. He is very grateful for the opportunity that he has been given by the Fundación and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a battery and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is 28 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer who faces challenges such as price fluctuations and seasonal weather variations. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goals are to buy land, grow crops and expand to new markets. He intends to use the loan to pay for the cost of hiring labor.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of hiring labor.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a hardworking farmer living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been farming for three years, and he farms on the family's land. However, Alfred faces challenges such as price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His family goals are to build a permanent house and buy a car. He hopes to diversify his business and hire employees. Alfred needs the loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a 36-year-old single mother of one child who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in cosmetics sales for 10 years. 

She began as a helper in a salon and later started a cosmetic shop. 

Her hardships are price fluctuations, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. Her personal goals are educating her child, building a permanent home and buying a car. Her business goals are diversifying her business and buying land on which to grow crops. 

Teddy is requesting a loan to buy hair weaves and other cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and other cosmetics to sell.
